title: Back Server
description:
Introducing Mēdüzā Mediterrania, an extraordinary culinary journey inspired by the timeless allure and captivating essence of the Mediterranean. At Mēdüzā, time slows as vibrant Mediterranean traditions blend with old-world habitats. We dedicate every moment to celebrating the beauty of each meal, offering a high-energy, boundary-transcending fine dining experience that transports you to sun-kissed coasts, azure waters, and vibrant culture of the region. We redefine Mediterranean cuisine, honoring its rich heritage while pushing culinary innovation. Our name, Mēdüzā, pays homage to the rich mythology and embodies the captivating allure that awaits our guests. Introducing Mēdüzā Mediterrania, an extraordinary culinary journey inspired by the timeless allure and captivating essence of the Mediterranean. At Mēdüzā, time slows as vibrant Mediterranean traditions blend with old-world habitats. We dedicate every moment to celebrating the beauty of each meal, offering a high-energy, boundary-transcending fine dining experience that transports you to sun-kissed coasts, azure waters, and vibrant culture of the region. We redefine Mediterranean cuisine, honoring its rich heritage while pushing culinary innovation. Our name, Mēdüzā, pays homage to the rich mythology and embodies the captivating allure that awaits our guests.  



  

The Back Server plays a vital role in creating exceptional guest experiences. Back Servers help the Server make sure every detail is taken care of. The primary objective of the Back Server is to be the primary table assistant for their assigned Server or section. Back Servers clear dirty flatware and glasses, assist with guest communication, and anticipate the needs of the guest to ensure the dining experience is seamless and enjoyable.

**Responsibilities**

* Assist Server with greeting tables when applicable
* Execute water service—pouring, refilling, maintaining water levels
* Ensure table is prepared for the upcoming course—silverware, plates, linen, etc.
* Ensure table is free of foreign objects, trash, unused plates and glassware
* Deliver beverages from the service bar to guests in their sections
* Request printed ticket from Server for each table to anticipate what items are coming
* Assist guests and communicate effectively from guest to server to kitchen staff
* Clear and reset tables in timely manner immediately after guests depart
* Spot check tables, floors, booths and chairs of entire section for trash and gum
* Clean up of any spills in sections and stock and maintain side stations
* Suggest cocktails and food items to guests and relay orders to the Server
* Shadow the Server – either the Back Server or Server must remain in section at ALL times

**Qualifications**

* A clean and professional appearance
* Strong multitasking abilities and a diligent work ethic
* Ability to forecast and anticipate the needs of our guests and the restaurant
* Available nights, weekends and holidays
* Ability to stand for the duration of shifts and lift up to 35lbs
* Experience in fine dining or similar full-service establishment preferred

INDFOH

title: Sommelier
description:
**New Restaurant and Concept Opening - Meduza Mediterrania NYC!!!!**  

The Noble 33 Hospitality and lifestyle company is seeking a **Sommelier****for Meduza Mediterrania - NEW YORK CITY !** We are seeking a dynamic and experienced Sommelier to join our team at our exciting high-energy lifestyle restaurant concept. As our sommelier, you will be responsible for curating a unique and extensive wine list that pairs perfectly with our delicious cuisine and appeals to our diverse clientele. The ideal candidate will have a passion for wine and a deep understanding of various grape varietals, regions, and production methods. You should have excellent communication skills and the ability to engage with guests, offering expert recommendations and enhancing their dining experience.

**Duties and Functions:**

* Develop and maintain an extensive wine list that complements our cuisine
* Conduct regular tastings and stay up-to-date on industry trends
* Work with our culinary team to ensure wine pairings enhance the flavor profiles of our dishes
* Train and educate staff on wine selections and service techniques
* Maintain high visibility in dining room to receive guests and to ensure prompt, efficient, and knowledgeable service
* Ensure proper storage, inventory management, and ordering of wine and related accessories
* Make sure that all closing side work has been completed.
* Closing duties, including: recording staff tips and hours, reconciling cash, writing service recap, checking service team closing duties and performing a final walkthrough of the restaurant.
* Motivating and leading staff to perform at the highest possible level through positive reinforcement
* Participate in ongoing staff training and development, collaborating with the rest of the management team to identify and address opportunities for feedback and coaching among the FOH staff
* Perform other job-related duties as assigned

**Specific Job Knowledge & Skills:**  

* At least 3 years of experience as a Sommelier in a high-end restaurant or hospitality environment
* Extensive knowledge of various grape varietals, regions, and production methods
* Ability to communicate and work in English. Additional languages are beneficial.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
* Ability to work in a fast-paced, high-energy environment
**Physical Abilities:*** Reach overhead and below the knees, including bending, twisting,pulling, and stooping
* Ability to stand for long periods of time
* Professional appearance, care and grooming
* Required to be able to lift or move up to 50 pounds without assistance

**Benefits:*** Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Vision insurance
* Paid Time Off

  

**We offer opportunities for growth and development. We pride ourselves on our fast-paced culture supported by leaders who propel you to your full potential. If you want to join our dynamic team, we invite you to apply!**  

  

INDFOH

Food Runners are responsible for controlling the flow of food in and out of the kitchen and maintaining clear communication between the kitchen and front of house team. Additional responsibilities include setting tables, serving food orders, and removing used dishes and utensils. Runners must have extensive menu knowledge to be able to correctly name each dish (including modifications) as it is delivered to a table. It is your responsibility to ensure our guests have a high-quality dining experience by serving their food in a timely and accurate manner.

**Responsibilities**

* Deliver hot food to guests, identifying each item, and ensuring the guests’ orders have been properly fulfilled
* Maintain a working environment that complies with health and safety guidelines
* Be attentive—proactively anticipate the needs of coworkers and guests
* Deliver a consistently high level of customer service to each guest

**Qualifications**

* Availability to work various shifts including nights, weekends, and holidays
* Ability to stand for the duration of shifts and lift/push/pull up to 35 lbs

The Noble 33 Hospitality and lifestyle company is seeking a **Bar Manager** **for Meduza Mediterrania - NEW YORK CITY !** The **Bar Manager** reports to the General Manager and is responsible for managing bar inventory, supply & standards as well as the bar team. With oversight from the General Manager and Beverage Director, the Bar Manager oversees all day to day beverage functions & operations including marketing initiatives, staff scheduling, training and execution, cost control and driving top line revenue as continual focus. Additionally, the Bar Manager actively participates in managing the daily operations of the venue as a whole.

 **Roles &** **Responsibilities**  

* Drive service standards for Bar Department
* Accuracy and consistency encompassing all things beverage
* Trainings for both new and current staff
* Overall responsibility and awareness of beverage cost
* Ensure steps of service are being met and executed by all bar staff
* Communicate menu changes, updates, and specials to bar staff as well as management
* Day to Day Beverage Management
* Responsibility of liquor room; all items going in and out, protection, organization
* Assisting staff in constant growth and learning by company standards
* Overall responsibility and awareness of beverage cost, comp, voids, spills on a nightly basis
* Communicate any staffing changes needed or unexpected staffing changes to management team
* Correspond any 86’d items to management
* Cleanliness and organization of bar and liquor room
* Make sure that opening and closing duties are being completed
* Schedules for Bartenders and Barbacks
* Ensure brand standards are maintained
* Ensure correct product is being used as specified by Beverage Director and on menu
* Relay any changes on menu to management and staff
* Proper back bar and well placement of spirits
* Oversee preparation of cocktails, making sure the right measurements and ingredients are being used.
* Help push staff incentive programs
* Manage Inventory and Labor
* Overall responsibility and awareness of beverage cost
* Perform monthly inventory
* Inventory organization
* Ordering and receiving process
* Ensure safekeeping of invoices
* Staff scheduling
* Awareness of breaks and overtime

**Qualifications**  

* 3 -5 years in a management or supervisory role preferably in a upscale restaurant
* Previous work in the hospitality industry; have a passion for service and understand what is needed to provide a high level of hospitality
* Strong knowledge in cocktails, spirits and wine
* Can lead and deliver a high performance team environment
* Organized and detail-oriented & strong interpersonal and communication skills
* Basic computer skills required.
* Capable of working overtime, weekends, evenings, and special events as needed.
* Knowledge of the industry and relevant health and safety regulations.
* Leadership skills and ability to make decisions quickly and under pressure.

**Requirements**  

* Must be able to lift up to 50 lbs, and frequently lift and bend from the waist.
* Must be able to stand for long periods.
* This position requires frequent use of hands and arms in repetitive motions.
* Regularly required to handle alcoholic beverages.
* High school diploma or GED is preferred.

title: Advisor
description:
Attention finance, insurance, and sales professionalsâ€”are you ready to take on a position that challenges your skills and rewards your performance? Cetera Financial Institutions is looking for motivated and capable individuals to fill the role of a Managed Financial Professional.


With a strong focus on sales and customer service, the Managed Financial Professional should be a true â€œpeople person' who enjoys developing professional and mutually beneficial relationships with a wide variety of customers. Candidates should be self-motivated and driven to exceed expectations in all that they do.


**What you will do:**

The Managed Financial Professional position is responsible for meeting with current and potential bank customers to help determine the best way to serve those customersâ€™ investment planning goals. Get more out of your career with a company that invests in YOUR success â€“ Welcome to Cetera!


The Financial Professional will proactively develop a client base to which appropriate wealth management products can be sold. Duties will include:


* Collecting and analyzing information regarding the customer risk tolerance, long- and short-term goals, income, assets, investments, and debts; determining which products best meet the customer needs and circumstances
* Advising the customer regarding the advantages, risks, and disadvantages of different products
* Developing internal referral resources to identify customers
* Identifying external prospects and expanding new client relationships
* Identifying cross-sell opportunities, including opportunities to refer customers to other lines of bank representatives through proper customer profiling and needs-based selling
* Understanding and complying with all aspects of bank and Cetera policies and practices, including laws and regulations governing the duties and responsibilities of product sales
* Maintaining all necessary licenses and registrations as required
* Successfully completing all mandatory training in a timely manner
* Maintaining superior and courteous service to promote products and expand customer relationships
* Exceeding customer expectations in terms of accuracy, efficiency, courtesy, and professionalism

**What you will have:**

* FINRA Series 7, 63 **(Required)**
* State Life & Health Insurance License of state where applying
* Strong sales, marketing, and business development skills
* 2 years of experience in finance, insurance and/or banking
* High School Diploma or equivalent

**What is nice to have:**

* FINRA Series 65, or 66, preferred

#LI-Onsite


  

  
**What we give you in return:**

Not many teams can say that they support peopleâ€™s dreams coming to lifeâ€¦ We happen to do that every day. And as important as we know your career is, we recognize that thereâ€™s a whole lot more to life. To ensure that our Employees can make the most of their time outside of working hours, we offer a competitive salary and for full-time roles, a benefits package including:


* Inclusive health, dental, vision and life insurance plans built to support diverse lifestyles, offer preventative care, and protect against hardship.
* Easy access to mental health benefits to meet our team members and their families where they are.
* 20+ days of paid time off (PTO), paid holidays, 1 paid wellness day and 1 days of paid volunteer time off (VTO) to give our employees the time they need to stay close with their loved ones, recharge, and give back to their communities.
* 401(k) Savings plan with a generous company contribution (up to 5%), and access to a financial professional to offer our employees the opportunity to plan-ahead for a strong financial future well beyond their working years.
* Paid parental leave to support all team members with birth, adoption, and foster.
* Health Savings and Flexible Spending Account options to help you save money on healthcare, daycare, commuting, and more.
* Employee Assistance Program (EAP), LifeLock, Pet Insurance and more.

**About Cetera Financial Group:**

Cetera Financial Group Â® ("Cetera") is a leading network of independent retail broker-dealers empowering the delivery of objective financial advice to individuals, families and company retirement plans across the country through trusted financial advisors and financial institutions. Cetera is an independent financial advisor network and a leading provider of retail services to the investment programs of banks and credit unions.


Through its multiple distinct firms, Cetera offers independent and institutions-based advisors the benefits of a large, established broker-dealer and registered investment adviser, while serving advisors and institutions in a way that is customized to their needs and aspirations. Advisor support resources offered through Cetera include award-winning wealth management and advisory platforms, comprehensive broker-dealer and registered investment adviser services, practice management support and innovative technology.

title: ATTORNEY
description:
**Job Overview**  
Sole practitioner with a small midtown law firm located near Grand Central Terminal is seeking a skilled attorney with a minimum three (3) years general practice including LItigation. The firm's practice consists of commercial litigation and commercial real estate transactions.

**Duties:**  
- You will be required to make court appearances  
- You will be required to draft legal documents such as briefs, pleadings, motions, etc.  
- You will be required to commute to our New York midtown law office.

**Requirements**:

-Must be a member of the New York State Bar in good standing

-Must have a Juris Doctor (J.D.) degree from an accredited law school

-Must have excellent communication and interpersonal skills

-Must have the ability to conduct thorough legal research

-Must have proficiency in drafting legal documents

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $150,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Life insurance
* Vision insurance

Experience:

* Litigation: 3 years (Required)

License/Certification:

* Bar (Required)

Ability to Commute:

* New York, NY 10017 (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

* New York, NY 10017: Relocate before starting work (Required)

title: DSP Direct Support Professional - 16 hrs
description:
**Department for Persons with Disabilities (DPD)**


**Regular Salary:** **$20.06** per hour Mon-Fri and **$21.06** per hour (shifts beginning 11PM Friday to 11PM on Sunday).


**Are you passionate about making a difference in others' lives? Then come join the DPD team!**


**Department for Persons with Disabilities (DPD) is one of the largest Catholic Charities Agencies providing care for adults with intellectual and developmental disabilities in the United States. We** **are looking for dedicated, caring and compassionate people to work in our Group Homes.**


**What’s the role of a Direct Support Professional/Overnight Residential Counselor (DSP)?**


* Residential Counselor is a direct care professional whose primary responsibility is to help meet the personal health, safety and welfare of the people living in the group home.
* You will assist and/or supervise individuals in personal care areas i.e. bathing/toileting; participate and/or supervise in cleaning, cooking and life skills.
* Administer and/or assist with medication administration.
* You must communicate effectively with supervisors, co-workers and the individuals living in the homes.
* Drive residents to/from day programs, outside/within their community using agency vehicles.
* This position requires daily documentation of services provided.
* Assist with fun community based activities


**Great Benefits:** For full time positions, (30+ per week) we offer:


* We provide PAID training
* Medical/vision and dental
* Life insurance (agency-paid), supplemental life insurance (employee-paid)
* Flexible spending accounts
* Accidental/Critical Illness Insurance
* 403B (with company-matching)
* Generous paid time off


**Job Requirements:**


* Be motivated to work as part of a team that acts in the best interest of our residents at all times
* Experience with ID/DD population is a plus
* This career requires HS diploma or equivalent
* A valid (non-provisional) driver’s license
* The ability to meet the physical requirements of CPR/First Aid and our emergency evacuation procedures.


**Part Time-Shift:** **16 hours per week, (Saturday 12pm – 8pm, Sunday 7am – 3 pm)**


All offers of employment are contingent on the successful completion/passing of our criminal background/references/DMV check, fingerprinting, pre-employment physical and drug test, etc.


All staff must attend a monthly Staff Meeting – date/time to be determined and announced in advance


Meeting waivers are provided for conflicts due to secondary employment and/or school (appropriate documentation required).

title: Claims Analyst
description:
Gellert Global Group consists of many of the leading North American food importing companies (Atalanta Corporation, Camerican International, Finica, Tipico Cheese Products) and has been importing food products for over 100 years. The combined revenues of GGG exceed $1.7 billion. GGG companies provide strength in sourcing, insurance, finance, logistics, food safety, and information technology, and supply the needs of retailers, distributors, food service chains, hotels, cruise lines, and food manufacturers alike.


GGG is seeking a self-motivated and results oriented Inventory Claims Coordinator to handle all aspects of transportation, warehouse, and supplier claims. In this role, the successful candidate will interact and communicate with all internal departments, external vendors, and customers to mitigate, remedy, and minimize potential losses.


**Responsibilities include but not limited to:**  

* Communication with external vendors as follows:

* Steamship liners – for issues that may occur during ocean travels
* Truck carriers – for discrepancies and issues during deliveries to customers and other warehouses
* Warehouses ensure accuracy of stored inventory by reconciling monthly inventory reports
* Suppliers – for issues regarding manufacturing/production process


* Enter and track claims in internal system
* Research and analyze incidents in order to determine validity of claim and potential loss
* Evaluate and recommend timely settlement and claim resolution to management
* Identify and gather all relevant information including documentation and applicable invoices to submit for a formal claim statement
* Provide guidance and instruction to vendors on corrective action measures
* Generate reports and conduct trend analysis to identify repetitive patterns with external clients
* Work cross-functionally to mitigate loss of old, surplus, and out of date inventory with salvaging efforts
* Process Certificate of Liability Insurance requests and maintain database
* Assist AR with customer deductions related to shortages, damages, overages, returns, and rejections
* Coordinate with Logistics to assist in the movement of (damaged) product
* Provide updates on progress regarding incidents to all parties involved


**Qualifications:**  

* Bachelor's degree or an equivalent combination of education and claims processing experience
* One to three years of experience handling cargo claims preferred
* Excellent written and oral communication skills
* Proficient with Microsoft Office; advanced Excel a must
* Ability to manage multiple priorities as well as flexibility to adapt to change with new systems and methods while working in a team environment
* Must be detail-oriented and organized and possess good time management skills
* Creative problem-solving skills
* Exposure to Accounts Receivable is a plus

***Our Benefits***


We care about your total well-being and will support you with the following, subject to your location and role.


* ***Health:*** Medical, dental and vision insurance, Company-paid life, accident and long-term disability insurance, flexible spending accounts
* ***Wealth:*** Competitive pay, annual bonus opportunity, matching 401(k) with immediate vesting upon enrollment, generous employee referral program
* ***Happiness:***
	+ ***Professional Growth:*** Online training courses, virtual and classroom development experiences, education assistance program
	+ ***Work-Life Balance:*** Paid-time off, parental leave, flexible work schedules (subject to your location and role)
	+ ***Team Building:*** Employee engagement and recognition programs, wellness, philanthropic and DE&I initiatives, Company-sponsored celebrations, and team-building events

*The Gellert Global Group of companies is an equal opportunity employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to sex, race, color, religion, ethnic or national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, pregnancy, leave status, disability, veteran status, genetic information and/or any other characteristic or status protected by national, federal, state, or local law. Gellert Global Group is committed to providing access, equal opportunity, and reasonable accommodation for individuals with disabilities in employment, its services, programs, and activities. Accordingly, if reasonable accommodation is required to fully participate in the job application or interview process, to perform the essential functions of the position, and/or to receive all other benefits and privileges of employment, please contact* *hr@gellertglobalgroup.com**.*

title: Community Manager
description:
**Who We Are**  

South Oxford Management is a full-service property management company with locations in Texas, Georgia, Virginia, New Jersey, Florida, and Connecticut. We are dedicated to offering an exceptional experience to our residents and team members. Our owners bring years of expertise in the industry to South Oxford Management, assuring quality in every aspect of our business. From asset management to leasing, we are passionate about making positive experiences for people. Putting people first is our mission.  

When you join South Oxford Management, you become part of a team, where you’re encouraged to learn, share ideas, and participate in team building and charitable activities.  

How You Will Contribute  

The Community Manager is the powerhouse that drives the community. They manage and coordinate people, activities, and available resources to provide a seamless community to residents, future residents, visitors, and team members. The Community Manager is responsible for all aspects of the community's operation and performance.  

**Things You Will Do**  

*Leadership*  

* Hire, train and supervise all team members through a positive mentoring approach
* Conduct on-going training with team members and monitor’s progress
* Take ownership and lead by example
* Empower team members by setting high goals to challenge your team, while also holding yourself accountable for their success
* Conducts annual performance reviews
* Assist in the hiring process by vetting candidates to select viable candidates
* Provide comprehensive feedback to all team members, document and facilitate disciplinary procedures as necessary
* Work closely with Maintenance Supervisor to monitor and schedule make-readies and other maintenance activities like capital projects progress, and preventive maintenance programs


*Financials*  

* Prepare and execute community budget
* Prepare weekly and monthly reports
* Ensure that rent is collected and posted in a timely manner and bank deposits are made immediately and reported to the home office
* Increase the value of the community and continuously look for ways to maximize NOI
* Maintain open communication with vendors and contractors concerning work scheduling, billing, vendor relations and certificates of insurance
* Submit invoices for payment promptly
* Suggest rental rate recommendations to Regional Manager
* Have a strong working knowledge of the market and comp set
* Report liability and community incidents to the required distribution group


*Leasing*  

* Oversee the screening process and vetting of applicants for credit worthiness Assume responsibility for office and model apartments opening on schedule and in excellent condition
* Provide outstanding customer service to residents and future residents
* Take pride in the apartment community; visually inspect and address areas of concern, keep community clean and report service needs to maintenance team members
* Maintain an organized environment even during busy times


*Customer Service*  

* Answer incoming phone calls and handle accordingly
* Build relationships with residents through courteous and timely response to needs and concerns
* Think safety first and ensure that unsafe conditions are corrected promptly
* Visually inspect/prepare entire property (office, models, compactor, vacant, curb appeal and amenity areas) daily for cleanliness. Inspect and touch up model and vacant units. Responsible for maintaining work area and office cleanliness.
* Know your market by being abreast of competition and surrounding area
* Communicate effectively with residents, future residents, visitors, vendors, and team members while presenting a positive, professional image
* Perform additional duties as assigned by district or regional manager
  

  

**Things You Need**  

* High School diploma or equivalent; bachelor’s degree preferred
* Three or more years of experience in property management with at least one year as a Community Manager
* Willing to work flexible schedule including weekends and holidays
* A sharp, professional appearance
* Must be able to walk the property which includes climbing stairs
* Must be able to bend, stoop, squat, kneel, climb stairs, push, pull, reach, carry supplies
* Stand for extended periods of time
* May be required to lift to 25 pounds without assistance
* Skills:


 o Dynamic team leadership and communication abilities  

 o Working Knowledge of Fair Housing Laws  

 o Working knowledge of Affordable Housing programs  

 o Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, and Outlook)  

 o Able to multitask and meet deadlines in a timely manner  

 o Knowledge of Yardi or other industry software preferred  

  

**What We Will Provide You**  

South Oxford Management LLC provides a range of insurance options and benefits for our full-time team members. Including:  

* Medical/Rx
* Dental
* Vision
* Employer Paid Life/AD&D
* Voluntary Life/AD&D
* Short Term Disability
* Long Term Disability
* Employee Assistance Program
* Accident Plan
* Hospital Indemnity Plan
* Critical Illness Plan
* Legal/ID Theft Protection
* Pet Insurance
* 401(k) Retirement w/ Match + Immediate Vesting
* Paid Holidays and Time Off (3+ weeks)
* Rent Discount (30%)
* Tuition Reimbursement($2,000/year)
* Paid Parental Leave (4 weeks)
* Employee Referral Bonus
* Employee Rewards and Recognition
  

  

*You’re exceptional. Let us make you feel it. Join our team.*  

South Oxford Management LLC is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer EOE/M/F/D/V/SO.  

South Oxford Management LLC is committed to providing a workplace that is free from the use, sale, possession, or distribution of illegal drugs and alcohol as well as free from the abusive use of legal drugs or alcohol. All job applicants are required to take and successfully complete a drug and/or alcohol test before they will be permitted to begin employment. Applicants that refuse to take a test or do not cooperate with the test representatives will not be permitted to begin employment. If a test yields a positive result for drugs or alcohol, the Company may withdraw the offer of employment to an applicant where permitted by state law.

title: Unit Secretary - West Nyack, NY
description:
**Opportunities with Optum in the Tri-State region** (formerly CareMount Medical, ProHEALTH New York, Crystal Run Healthcare and Riverside Medical Group). Come make a difference in the lives of people who turn to us for care at one of our hundreds of locations across New York, New Jersey, and Connecticut. Work with state-of-the-art technology and brilliant co-workers who share your passion for helping people feel their best. Join a dynamic health care organization and discover the meaning behind **Caring. Connecting. Growing together.**


**Multi-Specialty**, part of Optum, has an immediate opening for a friendly, patient focused and detailed oriented **Unit Secretary** to join our team. The Unit Secretary is responsible for the completion of set processes and protocols, working cooperatively with all members of the care team to support the vision and mission of the organization, delivering excellent customer service and adhering to Lean processes. This role supports the team in meeting financial, clinical and service goals.


**Schedule:** Monday through Friday, a 37.5 hour work week between the hours of 8:00 am to 5:00 pm. The schedule will be determined by the supervisor upon hire.


**Location:** 2 Centerock Road, Second Floor, Admin Suite, West Nyack, NY 10994


**Primary Responsibilities:**


* Collecting data from patient charts to complete forms, prior authorizations and schedule appointments as needed
* Documenting and reporting the information and data collected in a retrievable understandable and readable format
* Faxing/scanning
* Documenting information acquired and services implemented in the patient health record
* Communicating openly with patients, caregivers, and other healthcare professionals regarding patient care
* Using effective professional communication skills and tools to acquire and disseminate relevant information to patients, caregivers, and health care providers across the continuum of care


**What are the reasons to consider working for UnitedHealth Group? Put it all together – competitive base pay, a full and comprehensive benefit program, performance rewards, and a management team who demonstrates their commitment to your success. Some of our offerings include:**


* Paid Time Off which you start to accrue with your first pay period plus 8 Paid Holidays
* Medical Plan options along with participation in a Health Spending Account or a Health Saving account
* Dental, Vision, Life& AD&D Insurance along with Short-term disability and Long-Term Disability coverage
* 401(k) Savings Plan, Employee Stock Purchase Plan
* Education Reimbursement
* Employee Discounts
* Employee Assistance Program
* Employee Referral Bonus Program
* Voluntary Benefits (pet insurance, legal insurance, LTC Insurance, etc.)
* More information can be downloaded at: http://uhg.hr/uhgbenefits


You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.

**Required Qualifications:**


* High School Diploma/GED (or higher)
* 1+ years of customer service experience in an office or healthcare setting
* Intermediate level of computer proficiency (including Microsoft Outlook, Teams)


**Preferred Qualifications:**


* Experience working with electronic health records
* Ability to learn and apply job functions, and minimal medical terminology knowledge


**Soft Skills:**


* Ability to work independently and as a team, and maintain good judgment and accountability
* Demonstrated ability to work well with health care providers
* Strong organizational and time management skills
* Ability to multi-task and prioritize tasks to meet all deadlines
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills; ability to speak clearly and concisely, conveying information in a manner that others can understand, as well as ability to understand and interpret information from others

  


**New York Residents Only:** The salary range for New York residents is $16.00 to $28.27 per hour. Pay is based on several factors including but not limited to local labor markets, education, work experience, certifications, etc. UnitedHealth Group complies with all minimum wage laws as applicable. In addition to your salary, UnitedHealth Group offers benefits such as, a comprehensive benefits package, incentive and recognition programs, equity stock purchase and 401k contribution (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). No matter where or when you begin a career with UnitedHealth Group, you’ll find a far-reaching choice of benefits and incentives.

  


*At UnitedHealth Group, our mission is to help people live healthier lives and make the health system work better for everyone. We believe everyone–of every race, gender, sexuality, age, location, and income–deserves the opportunity to live their healthiest life. Today, however, there are still far too many barriers to good health which are disproportionately experienced by people of color, historically marginalized groups, and those with lower incomes. We are committed to mitigating our impact on the environment and enabling and delivering equitable care that addresses health disparities and improves health outcomes — an enterprise priority reflected in our mission.*

  


*Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.*


*UnitedHealth Group is a drug - free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment.*

title: Registered Nurse RN Field Clinician Hudson County, NJ
description:
**\\*\\*\\*$5,000 Sign bonus being offered for external candidates\\*\\*\\***



Optum Home & Community Care, part of the UnitedHealth Group family of businesses, is creating something new in health care. We are uniting industry-leading solutions to build an integrated care model that holistically addresses an individual’s physical, mental and social needs – helping patients access and navigate care anytime and anywhere.

  

As a team member of our Senior Community Care (SCC) product, we work with a team to provide care to patients at home in a nursing home, assisted living for senior housing. This life-changing work adds a layer of support to improve access to care.

  

We’re connecting care to create a seamless health journey for patients across care settings. Join us to start **Caring. Connecting. Growing together.**

  

The Senior Community Care (SCC) program is a longitudinal, integrated care delivery program that coordinates the delivery and provision of clinical care of members in a facility setting. The **Optum Care Team RN** within SCC provides care to our highest-risk health plan members and is part of an interdisciplinary team consisting of an Advanced Practice Clinician (APC) and a Patient Care Coordinator (PCC). In this role you will have the ability to achieve work life balance. No on-call, no weekends, and no holidays required.



**Work schedule is Monday to Friday 8:00 AM - 5:00 PM in your time zone**

  

**Primary Responsibilities:**


* Ensure accurate and complete documentation
* Communicate and collaborate with the interdisciplinary care team
* Collaborate and communicate with PCC to support APC care and scheduling of member
* Assist the provider / team with various care coordination activities
* Assist the provider / team with benefit determination associated with Medicare part A, part B, and part D benefits
* Collaborating with the primary APC and facility to identify and respond to patient change in condition
* Assist the provider / team with therapy coordination
* Participate in facility-based meetings
* Schedule and participate in family conferences, team meetings, and team case presentations
* Coordination of training, tracking, and compliance with quality measures
* Assist in creating and conduct in-services for selected audiences
* Assist Providers in assuring complete and accurate documentation and coding, medication reconciliation, nursing rounds, assessment, and patient documentation
* May write verbal orders from Provider in the chart in compliance with the state RN practice laws, and in compliance with individual nursing facility practices
* Assist in managing members through an acute medical situation or an exacerbation of a chronic condition, including testing, diagnostics, interventions
* Assist in managing members during a short term sub-acute rehabilitation episode

  

  

You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.

**Required Qualifications:**


* Associate degree or higher in Nursing (RN)
* Active and unrestricted license in the state which you reside, or ability to obtain by start date
* Certified in Basic Life Support
* Ability to complete physical requirements, including lifting a 30-pound bag and ability to perform physical assessment
* Access to reliable transportation
* Ability to travel in between facilities

  

  

**Preferred Qualifications:**


* 1+ years of clinical experience in practice (acute care setting)
* Experience in meeting the medical needs of patients with complex behavioral, social and/or functional needs
* Saline Lock insertion experience
* Understanding of Geriatrics and Chronic Illness

  


**Professionalism:**


* Personal and Professional Accountability
* Create an environment that facilitates the team to initiate actions that produce positive results
* Ability to hold self and others accountable for actions and results
* Answers for one’s own behavior and actions
* Create an environment in which professional and personal growth are an expectation
* Integrate high ethical standards and UHG core values into everyday work activities

  

  

**New Jersey Residents Only:**The hourly range for this role is $28.03 to $54.95 per hour. Pay is based on several factors including but not limited to local labor markets, education, work experience, certifications, etc. UnitedHealth Group complies with all minimum wage laws as applicable. In addition to your salary, UnitedHealth Group offers benefits such as, a comprehensive benefits package, incentive and recognition programs, equity stock purchase and 401k contribution (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). No matter where or when you begin a career with UnitedHealth Group, you’ll find a far-reaching choice of benefits and incentives.

  

*At UnitedHealth Group, our mission is to help people live healthier lives and make the health system work better for everyone. We believe everyone–of every race, gender, sexuality, age, location and income–deserves the opportunity to live their healthiest life. Today, however, there are still far too many barriers to good health which are disproportionately experienced by people of color, historically marginalized groups and those with lower incomes. We are committed to mitigating our impact on the environment and enabling and delivering equitable care that addresses health disparities and improves health outcomes - an enterprise priority reflected in our mission.*



*Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.*

  

*UnitedHealth Group is a drug-free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment.*

description:
**\\*\\*\\*$5,000 Sign on bonus for external candidates\\*\\*\\***



Optum Home & Community Care, part of the UnitedHealth Group family of businesses, is creating something new in health care. We are uniting industry-leading solutions to build an integrated care model that holistically addresses an individual’s physical, mental and social needs – helping patients access and navigate care anytime and anywhere.

  

As a team member of our Senior Community Care (SCC) product, we work with a team to provide care to patients at home in a nursing home, assisted living for senior housing. This life-changing work adds a layer of support to improve access to care.

  

We’re connecting care to create a seamless health journey for patients across care settings. Join us to start **Caring. Connecting. Growing together.**

  

The Senior Community Care (SCC) program is a longitudinal, integrated care delivery program that coordinates the delivery and provision of clinical care of members in a facility setting. The **Optum Care Team RN** within SCC provides care to our highest-risk health plan members and is part of an interdisciplinary team consisting of an Advanced Practice Clinician (APC) and a Patient Care Coordinator (PCC). In this role you will have the ability to achieve work life balance. No on-call, no weekends, and no holidays required.



**Work schedule is Monday to Friday 8:00 AM - 5:00 PM in your time zone**

  

**Primary Responsibilities:**


* Ensure accurate and complete documentation
* Communicate and collaborate with the interdisciplinary care team
* Collaborate and communicate with PCC to support APC care and scheduling of member
* Assist the provider / team with various care coordination activities
* Assist the provider / team with benefit determination associated with Medicare part A, part B, and part D benefits
* Collaborating with the primary APC and facility to identify and respond to patient change in condition
* Assist the provider / team with therapy coordination
* Participate in facility-based meetings
* Schedule and participate in family conferences, team meetings, and team case presentations
* Coordination of training, tracking, and compliance with quality measures
* Assist in creating and conduct in-services for selected audiences
* Assist Providers in assuring complete and accurate documentation and coding, medication reconciliation, nursing rounds, assessment, and patient documentation
* May write verbal orders from Provider in the chart in compliance with the state RN practice laws, and in compliance with individual nursing facility practices
* Assist in managing members through an acute medical situation or an exacerbation of a chronic condition, including testing, diagnostics, interventions
* Assist in managing members during a short term sub-acute rehabilitation episode

  

  

You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.

**Required Qualifications:**


* Associate degree or higher in Nursing (RN)
* Active and unrestricted license in the state which you reside, or ability to obtain by start date
* Certified in Basic Life Support
* Ability to complete physical requirements, including lifting a 30-pound bag and ability to perform physical assessment
* Access to reliable transportation
* Ability to travel in between facilities

  

  

**Preferred Qualifications:**


* 1+ years of clinical experience in practice (acute care setting)
* Experience in meeting the medical needs of patients with complex behavioral, social and/or functional needs
* Saline Lock insertion experience
* Understanding of Geriatrics and Chronic Illness


**Professionalism:**


* Personal and Professional Accountability
* Create an environment that facilitates the team to initiate actions that produce positive results
* Ability to hold self and others accountable for actions and results
* Answers for one’s own behavior and actions
* Create an environment in which professional and personal growth are an expectation
* Integrate high ethical standards and UHG core values into everyday work activities

  

  

**New Jersey Residents Only:** The hourly range for this role is $28.03 to $54.95 per hour. Pay is based on several factors including but not limited to local labor markets, education, work experience, certifications, etc. UnitedHealth Group complies with all minimum wage laws as applicable. In addition to your salary, UnitedHealth Group offers benefits such as, a comprehensive benefits package, incentive and recognition programs, equity stock purchase and 401k contribution (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). No matter where or when you begin a career with UnitedHealth Group, you’ll find a far-reaching choice of benefits and incentives.

  

*At UnitedHealth Group, our mission is to help people live healthier lives and make the health system work better for everyone. We believe everyone–of every race, gender, sexuality, age, location and income–deserves the opportunity to live their healthiest life. Today, however, there are still far too many barriers to good health which are disproportionately experienced by people of color, historically marginalized groups and those with lower incomes. We are committed to mitigating our impact on the environment and enabling and delivering equitable care that addresses health disparities and improves health outcomes - an enterprise priority reflected in our mission.*



*Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.*

  

*UnitedHealth Group is a drug-free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment.*
company_description: Optum is a health services and innovation company on a mission to help people live healthier lives and to help make the health system work better for everyone.

title: Operations Inventory Coordinator - Basking Ridge, NJ
description:
For those who want to invent the future of health care, here's your opportunity. We're going beyond basic care to health programs integrated across the entire continuum of care. Join us to start **Caring. Connecting. Growing together.**



The Operations and Inventory Coordinator (formerly Office Manager) oversees the administrative functions of the office and office-based inventories in order to maintain a smooth, efficient, and productive flow of business operations.



**Primary Responsibilities:**


* Manages front office by greeting visitors, accepting deliveries, and coordinating with vendors necessary for office operations
* Responds to general inquiries in the form of incoming calls, faxes, and in-person drop ins
* Responsible for opening and closing the office, locking and unlocking doors, and maintaining tidy waiting and common areas
* Maintains supply inventories and follows established processes and procedures for ordering, storage, and auditing of both general office and medical supplies, which includes medications, vaccines, and sterile medical equipment
* Ensures invoices from vendors are submitted for payment in a timely manner
* Package and mail supplies and documents to remote employees
* Completes quarterly medication box audits, following procedures and processes established by the national pharmacy leadership team
* Enters updates to provider on-call schedule into scheduling system, including managing schedule changes throughout the month
* Schedules local meetings as requested by local market leadership team and manages calendar and agenda for all recurring market team meetings
* Maintains market-specific email distribution lists
* Serves as key liaison for all facilities issues and interactions with building management
* Coordinates travel planning for members of the local market leadership team
* Organizes annual events for local employees including catering and/or facility reservations
* Completes company-provided respiratory FIT testing certification and performs annual respiratory FIT testing for patient-facing employees
* As needed, support market teams by scanning physical documents to be uploaded into patient charts
* Reports directly to the Market Executive Director


**Education and Experience:**


* To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily
* The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required
* Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions


You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.

**Required Qualifications:**


* High school diploma or equivalent
* 2+ years of professional experience in office management (medical setting preferred)
* Proven critical thinking skills and flexibility are required for success in role
* Proven knowledge of MS Office products, especially Outlook and Teams
* Proven ability to operate printer, fax, and copier machines
* Demonstrated ability to work independently, with minimal direct oversight
* Proven excellent organizational skills and solid attention to detail
* Demonstrated ability to work Monday to Friday from 8:30am to 5:00pm local time, on site within the area


**New Jersey Residents Only**: The hourly range for this role is $16.00 to $28.27 per hour. Pay is based on several factors including but not limited to local labor markets, education, work experience, certifications, etc. UnitedHealth Group complies with all minimum wage laws as applicable. In addition to your salary, UnitedHealth Group offers benefits such as, a comprehensive benefits package, incentive and recognition programs, equity stock purchase and 401k contribution (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). No matter where or when you begin a career with UnitedHealth Group, you’ll find a far-reaching choice of benefits and incentives.



*At UnitedHealth Group, our mission is to help people live healthier lives and make the health system work better for everyone. We believe everyone–of every race, gender, sexuality, age, location and income–deserves the opportunity to live their healthiest life. Today, however, there are still far too many barriers to good health which are disproportionately experienced by people of color, historically marginalized groups and those with lower incomes. We are committed to mitigating our impact on the environment and enabling and delivering equitable care that addresses health disparities and improves health outcomes — an enterprise priority reflected in our mission.*



*Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: OptumCare is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employers and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.*



*OptumCare is a drug-free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment.*

title: Nurse Practitioner, Per Diem
description:
**Mission Statement:**

Baltic Street Wellness Solutions is committed to providing peer recovery, person-centered, trauma informed, and compassionate services to those with mental health lived experience.

**Vision:**

Our vision is to drive a cultural transformation within the mental health community by advocating for the underserved, educating for change, and inspiring wellness. We approach our role with cultural humility and mindfulness of oppressive systems.

**Core Values:**

* We value a mentoring philosophy delivered from staff with peer lived experiences.
* We value the recovery journey of every individual with a mental health diagnosis.
* We value the personal and professional experiences of our staff and board members.
* We value community action to change societal views to break the stigma of mental health through advocacy within all systems.
* We value everyone’s desire to have opportunities to obtain their visions of wellness.
* We value education and training to enhance an individual’s opportunities for growth in one’s personal journey to self-discovery.

**Position Summary**

The Nurse Practitioner (NP) will conduct comprehensive physical and mental health assessments of individuals referred to the INSET program, alongside the social worker. Assess and diagnose mental health conditions, medical issues, and substance use/misuse as necessary. Develop individualized treatment plans in collaboration with the Social Worker and Peer Team Leader to address the specific needs and challenges of each participant. This includes medication management, therapeutic interventions, and psychoeducation. The Nurse Practitioner (NP) will need to regularly follow up with participants to track their progress, monitor treatment effectiveness, document accurately and adjust interventions as needed. Job description is subject to change. Must have On-Call flexibility.

**Qualifications:**

* Master of Science in Nursing (MSN) or Doctor of Nursing Practice (DNP) with a focus on psychiatric health or similar.
* National certification as a Psychiatric-Mental Health Nurse Practitioner (PMHNP) is typically required for this role.
* Must hold an active and unrestricted nursing license and New York State licensure to practice asa Nurse Practitioner in the psychiatric-mental health field.
* Previous experience in mental health nursing or psychiatric settings is highly beneficial.
* Strong communication, empathy, and interpersonal skills to work effectively with patients,families, and the interdisciplinary team.
* Ability to handle psychiatric crises and emergencies with a calm and composed demeanor.
* Sensitivity and understanding of diverse patient populations and cultural backgrounds.
* Effective time management and organizational skills to handle a caseload of patients and prioritize tasks efficiently.
* Familiarity with relevant laws, regulations, and ethical standards related to psychiatric care and patient confidentiality.
* An approved background check is required prior to employment.

**We Are a State Mandated Organization, COVID-19 Vaccinations are Required. Selected candidates must be vaccinated against COVID-19 and have received a booster shot. Baltic Street Wellness Solutions will require selected candidates to submit proof of complete vaccination against COVID-19 and having received a booster shot prior to extending a job offer. If a candidate has a qualifying medical condition or religious exemption that contraindicates a COVID-19 vaccination, an exemption form should be requested from Human Resources.**

**PHYSICAL DEMANDS AND WORK ENVIRONMENT**

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this position. Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the functions. While performing the duties of this position, the employee is regularly required to talk or listen. The employee frequently is required to use hands or finger, handle, or feel objects, tools, or controls. The employee is occasionally required to stand, walk, sit; reach with hands and arms. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 15 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this position include close vision, distance vision, peripheral vision, and the ability to adjust focus. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.

Pay: $90.00 - $110.00 per hour

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule
* Paid time off

Medical Specialty:

* Addiction Medicine

Education:

* Master's (Required)

Experience:

* Mental Health Nursing: 2 years (Required)

Language:

* any other languages (Preferred)

License/Certification:

* Nursing License in NYS (Required)
* Psychiatric-Mental Health Nurse Practitioner (PMHNP) (Required)

Willingness to travel:

* 50% (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: H.E.L.P. Operator
description:
**AutoBase Inc.** is family-owned and operated providing Safety Service Patrol for over 23 years. We are the largest provider of Safety Service Patrol in the industry!

**Our Opportunity:**

We are seeking a **Full Time and Part Time H.E.L.P. Operator**, to join our team in Westchester, NY.

**Full Time, Monday - Friday**

**Split Shifts:** 06:00 - 10:00 and 15:00 - 19:00

**Part Time, Saturday - Sunday**

**Shift:** 11:30 - 20:00

**Salary:** $26.25/hour

As a Safety Service Patrol Operator, also known as a H.E.L.P. Operator in the state of New York, you would patrol a designated highway route in a company truck, assisting disabled motorists, maintaining the flow of traffic, and supporting local and/state Police, Fire or Emergency Service Units for scene safety.

**Position Details:**

* Provides Traffic Incident Management services.
* Monitors the safety of roadways and assists with disabled/abandoned vehicles, lane-closures, debris in the roadway, and general roadway incidents.
* Uses provided tools and equipment for roadside assistance to stranded motorists, including but not limited to changing tires, jump starting a battery, providing coolant, providing fuel, and other minor mechanical repairs.
* Works closely with and assist other first responders with incident management.
* Maintaining online system for reporting incidents.
* Working with Traffic Management Centers to ensure following directives.

**REQUIRED MINIMUM EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE:**

* Successfully pass a comprehensive background and criminal check, as well as a drug test.
* High School diploma or GED
* Must have automotive mechanical knowledge or 2+ years of experience in a similar field.
* 3+ years of driving and demonstrated safe driving record.
* Must be able to perform the physical demands of the job, lifting tire and floor jack.
* A general working knowledge of traffic incident management is a plus.
* Military, Police or Firefighter background is a PLUS!

**CERTIFICATIONS AND/OR TECHNICAL REQUIREMENTS:**

* Must possess a valid state Driver’s License.
* Physical Required.
* Knowledge of all tools necessary to perform all maintenance repair.

**ABILITIES, PHYSICAL DEMANDS OF JOB REQUIRED:**

* Knowledge of vehicle operations and safety guidelines.
* Proficient in the use of all tools of the trade, shop equipment and power tools including but not limited to jacks, hydraulic lifts, air tools and diagnostic equipment.
* Ability to apply all relevant policies in a consistent, timely and objective manner.
* Capable of working with peers, the public and management from other departments in a proactive and constructive manner.
* While performing the duties of this job, it is regularly required to sit, stand, walk, use hands to handle or feel, reach with hands, talk, and hear.
* The position also frequently required to climb, balance, stoop, kneel, crouch, bend, or crawl. In addition to frequently lift and/or move up to 60lbs.

***Full Time Employee Benefits:***

* Company uniforms
* Boot reimbursement
* Performance based bonuses and raises
* Medical Insurance
* Dental Insurance
* Vision Insurance
* Short- & Long-Term disability coverage
* Critical & Accident Coverage
* $50,000.00 Company provided Life Insurance policy and the option of a voluntary buy-up policy.
* 401(k) plan with a match.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Pay: $26.25 per hour

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* On-the-job training
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Day shift
* Monday to Friday
* Night shift
* Weekends only

Education:

* High school or equivalent (Preferred)

Experience:

* Mechanic: 2 years (Preferred)
* Driving: 3 years (Preferred)

License/Certification:

* Driver's License (Preferred)

Work Location: On the road

title: Consumer Insights Analyst
description:
Consumer Insights Analyst

  

Sep 5, 2024


New York, NY


Summary

At Chobani, we ensure every cup we sell meets a happy customer. We’re a dedicated team. And it’s easy to be dedicated when you’re part of something much bigger than yourself. We’ve got an insatiable appetite for making a difference.  

Conducting quantitative and qualitative research and analytics, Chobani’s Marketing Insights team produces category, consumer and shopper insights to help inform marketing, product, and business decision making. As a key member of the Marketing Insights Team, the Consumer Insights Analyst makes use of company and syndicated data, integrated with primary consumer research, to help inform the design, development, and measurement of Chobani marketing strategies and initiatives



Responsibilities
* Make use of syndicated data (from sources like Nielsen and IRI), account-specific data, as well as consumer and shopper insights to provide regular summaries to internal teams on category, competitor, and Chobani performance.
* Analyze and summarize 3rd party reports to help create product-, category-, and industry-level insights and executive briefings.
* Contribute to the development of marketing measurement plans; support analysis and reporting of Chobani marketing initiative effectiveness.
* Partner on insight discovery via expert networks (Mintel, Nielsen, etc) as well as from industry professionals to tell a 360-degree story about categories Chobani is considering entering.
* Make use of tools / templates to facilitate analysis & reporting: provide ongoing trend reporting / analysis.
* Collect and clean data, interpret and evaluate statistical outputs, develop recommendations based on findings, and prepare reports/summaries for non-quantitative audiences.
* Analyze multiple data sources to generate pertinent and accurate summaries of key performance indicators versus objectives.
* Conduct ad hoc analyses and data pulls to answer time-sensitive questions.
* Collaborate closely with stakeholders in Product Marketing, Innovation (New Platform Development), Consumer Marketing, New Product development / R&D, and Commercial/Sales.
Requirements
* Minimum 2+ years experience in marketing analysis (or previous experience as a category analyst) with specific knowledge of IRI and/or Nielsen.
* Consumer panel data experience preferred (Homescan, Oracle etc.).
* Experience in consumer packaged goods industry preferred.
* Proficient in multiple statistical methods, including linear regression, A/B testing, hypothesis testing, survey methods, etc.
* Hands-on experience with statistical programs such as R, Python, SPSS, or STATA.
* Progressive thinker capable of extending or enhancing the existing set of analytical offerings.
* Proven analytical skills and ability to successfully integrate multiple, disparate streams of information into sound conclusions, recommendations and reports.
* Capable of building strong networks and working relationships by effectively influencing cross-functional stakeholders.
* Strong verbal, written, communication and presentation skills.
* Keen attention to detail and accuracy.
* Thrives in a fast-paced, dynamic environment both independently and as a team player.
* Highly organized with the ability to manage multiple projects against aggressive deadlines.
* Advanced Microsoft Office skills (including but not limited to Excel, Word and Power Point).
About Us

Chobani is a food maker with a mission of making high-quality and nutritious food accessible to more people, while elevating our communities and making the world a healthier place. In short: making good food for all. In support of this mission, Chobani is a purpose-driven, people-first, food-and-wellness-focused company, and has been since its founding in 2005 by Hamdi Ulukaya, an immigrant to the U.S. The Company manufactures yogurt, oat milk, and creamers – Chobani yogurt is America's No.1 yogurt brand, made with natural ingredients without artificial preservatives. Following the 2023 acquisition of La Colombe, a leading coffee roaster with a shared commitment to quality, craftmanship and impact, the Company began selling cold-pressed espresso and lattes on tap at 32 cafes, as well as Ready to Drink (RTD) coffee beverages at retail.


Chobani uses food as a force for good in the world – putting humanity first in everything it does. The company’s philanthropic efforts prioritize giving back to its communities and beyond: working to eradicate child hunger, supporting immigrants, refugees and underrepresented people, honoring veterans, and protecting the planet. Chobani manufactures its products in New York, Idaho, Michigan and Australia, and its products are available throughout North America and distributed in Australia and other select markets.


For more information, please visit www.chobani.com and www.lacolombe.com, or follow us on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and LinkedIn.


*Chobani is an equal opportunity employer. Chobani will not discriminate against any applicant for employment on any basis including, but not limited to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, military and/or veteran status, marital status, predisposing genetic characteristics and genetic information, or any other classification protected by federal, state, and local laws.*

  


*#LI-VK1*



Compensation Range: $61,600.00 - $92,400.00, plus bonus.
company_description: This evolution supports Chobani’s ambition to become a food-focused wellness company and providing better food to all people.

title: Cashier/Customer Service
description:
**New Restaurant Opening! Halal Nashville Hot Chicken!**

Providing excellent customer service and ensuring a positive dining experience. Responsibilites include, but not limited to:

1. **Customer Interaction**: Greet and seat customers, take orders, and provide recommendations on dishes or specials.

2. **Order Accuracy**: Ensure accurate order taking, input orders into the system, process front end orders, and communicate special requests to the kitchen.

3. **Service Efficiency**: Serve food and beverages promptly, check in with customers during their meals, and clear tables efficiently.

4. **Menu Knowledge**: Have a thorough understanding of the chicken restaurant's menu, including preparation methods, ingredients, and potential allergens.

5. **Upselling**: Skillfully suggest additional menu items, sides, or promotions to enhance the dining experience and contribute to sales.

6. **Team Collaboration**: Work closely with kitchen staff, fellow servers, and other restaurant personnel to maintain a smooth and efficient service.

7. **Cleanliness**: Maintaining clean personal hygiene, contribute to maintaining a clean and organized dining area, including clearing tables, resetting them, ensuring a tidy appearance, and keeping restrooms clean.

8. **Problem Resolution**: Address customer concerns or issues promptly and professionally, seeking assistance from management if needed.

9. **Payment Processing**: Handle customer payments accurately, process transactions, cash handling, and provide correct change when applicable.

10. **Compliance**: Adhere to food safety regulations, health standards, and the restaurant's policies and procedures.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $15.13 per hour

Expected hours: 20 – 40 per week

Shift:

* 10 hour shift
* 12 hour shift
* 8 hour shift
* Day shift
* Evening shift
* Night shift

Experience:

* Quick service & fast food restaurant: 2 years (Preferred)

Ability to Relocate:

* Township of Lawrence, NJ 08648: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Consultant Database Associate
description:
Summary:
The Consultant Database Team is a centralized center of excellence within the Marketing Group, responsible for support of the firm’s marketing and sales efforts through the distribution of content on the firm’s strategies and data via consultant databases. The team partners with the Consultant Relations Team, Sales, investment teams and business support functions to service client’s needs for data and information on the firm’s products.
We are seeking a successful candidate to work within the Consultant Database Team on content relating to equity, fixed income and multi-asset class strategies. The successful candidates should have strong desire to foster key relationships, deliver high quality content and improve processes.
Responsibilities:* Serve as primary data contact for Relationship Managers on key Consultant relationships
* Aggregate investment strategy performance and analytics data utilizing strong data management skills
* Complete consultant driven questionnaires / requests regarding investment products on a monthly or quarterly basis
* Review product profiles for accuracy and that product narratives such as investment summary, investment philosophy, etc. are up to date
* Research, initiate and implement innovative ideas and creative approaches to help increase the efficiency and further the goals of the Consultant Database team
* Ensure detailed understanding of the firm's products and investment processes to facilitate accurate and relevant distribution of information
* Complete various value added projects for Sales and Investment teams including competitor and peer ranking analysis, search activity trends and other general analysis
* Collaborate with various internal teams on internal projects


Requirements:* Undergraduate degree in finance, business, or related major preferred
* 3-5 years of experience, preferably, at an asset management firm
* Excellent time-management, planning and organizational skills
* Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal; ability to communicate effectively with senior sales professionals, portfolio managers and subject matter experts.
* High level of accuracy and attention to detail
* Proficient in Microsoft Word, PowerPoint and Excel
* Experience with the population of consultant databases and/or eVestment Analytics preferred


Compensation Details
The salary range for this role is $75,000-$95,000. This is the lowest to highest salary we in good faith believe we would pay for this role at the time of this posting. We may ultimately pay more or less than the posted range, and the range may be modified in the future. This range is only applicable for jobs to be performed in New York City. An employee’s pay position within the salary range will be based on several factors including, but limited to, relevant education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, seniority, geographic location, performance, shift, travel requirements, sales or revenue-based metrics, any collective bargaining agreements, and business or organizational needs. This job is also eligible for a discretionary bonus. We offer a comprehensive package of benefits including paid time off, medical/dental/vision insurance, 401(k), life insurance and other benefits to eligible employees.
Note: No amount of pay is considered to be wages or compensation until such amount is earned, vested, and determinable. The amount and availability of any bonus, commission, production, or any other form of compensation that are allocable to a particular employee remains in the Company's sole discretion unless and until paid and may be modified at the Company’s sole discretion, consistent with the law.*Neuberger Berman is an equal* *opportunity/affirmative* *action employer. title: Events Coordinator
description:
**Job Title: Events Coordinator/Assistant**

**Location:** The Roger Sherman Inn, New Canaan, CT

**Position Type:** Full-Time

**About The Roger Sherman Inn:** The Roger Sherman Inn is a distinguished wedding and events venue in New Canaan, Connecticut, known for its historic charm and exceptional service. We specialize in hosting weddings, corporate functions, and social events, providing a personalized and memorable experience for all our clients.

**Job Overview:** We are looking for a detail-oriented and proactive Events Coordinator/Assistant to support our Events Sales team. The ideal candidate will assist the Events Sales Manager with client communications, administrative tasks, and the coordination of event logistics. This position is ideal for someone who is highly organized, enjoys a fast-paced environment, and has a passion for events and hospitality.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Support the Events Sales Manager in the planning and execution of events, ensuring all details align with client expectations and venue standards.
* Assist with client inquiries, providing timely and accurate information about venue offerings, availability, and pricing.
* Coordinate site visits for prospective clients, preparing necessary materials and ensuring a professional presentation of the venue.
* Help manage client contracts, proposals, and other documentation, ensuring all paperwork is completed accurately and in a timely manner.
* Maintain event sales records and client files, ensuring data is up-to-date and organized.
* Assist in the preparation and distribution of event marketing materials, including brochures, flyers, and social media content.
* Coordinate with vendors and internal teams to ensure all event details are confirmed and executed smoothly.
* Support the Events Sales Manager in managing event timelines, budgets, and schedules.
* Provide on-site support during events as needed, assisting with setup, coordination, and troubleshooting any issues that arise.
* Handle post-event follow-up with clients to gather feedback and support future sales efforts.

**Qualifications:**

* Previous experience in event planning, sales support, or a related role is preferred.
* Strong organizational and multitasking skills, with a keen attention to detail.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
* Ability to work collaboratively as part of a team and independently when required.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite; experience with event management software is a plus.
* Ability to work flexible hours, including evenings and weekends, based on event schedules.
* A customer-focused mindset with a passion for delivering exceptional service.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $35,000.00 - $65,000.00 per year

title: Physical Therapy Assistant
description:
##### **Job Type: Contract**


##### **Job Category: Rehabilitation Therapy**


#### **Job Description**


Job Title: Physical Therapy Assistant


Job Summary:


As a Physical Therapy Assistant, you will work under the guidance and supervision of a licensed physical therapist to help patients regain mobility, manage pain, and improve their overall physical well-being. You will provide hands-on care to patients through various therapeutic exercises and techniques, as well as educate them on proper body mechanics and exercises they can do at home.


Responsibilities and Duties:

* Assist physical therapist in developing and implementing treatment plans for patients
* Administer therapeutic exercises and modalities, such as ultrasound and electrical stimulation
* Educate patients on proper use of assistive devices and techniques for improving mobility
* Document patient progress and update treatment plans as needed
* Communicate regularly with physical therapist and other healthcare team members to ensure coordinated care
* Assist in maintaining a clean and safe treatment environment


Qualifications and Skills:

* Associate's degree in Physical Therapy Assistant program
* Valid state license or certification as a Physical Therapy Assistant
* Strong interpersonal skills and ability to work well with patients of all ages
* Detail-oriented and able to follow specific instructions from physical therapist
* Physical stamina and strength to assist patients with mobility exercises
* Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written
