title: Strategic Partnership Manager Finance and Professional Services
description:
* Your mission is to drive sales growth for the US financial and professional services sector and position Climeworks as the leading CDR company in the mind of our prospects to accomplish our mission to reach at least 1billion ton of CO2 removal by 2050.
* You win key customers, aligned with the vertical goals.
* You find new leads and opportunities.
* You conduct outreach to discover new leads and opportunities.
* You build a robust sales funnel and accelerate opportunity creation.
* You focus on bringing ongoing sales discussions to a close.
* You reach and nurture C-level relationships of high-priority accounts (CSO, CFO, CEO as priority).
* You develop strategic relationships with top accounts and prospects.
* You follow the global strategy regarding event attendance and industry alliances.
  

* You are a university graduate, and ideally, a degree in sustainability would be advantageous.
* You have experience selling to the finance sector, insurance sector, and professional services (having worked in the financial sector yourself, preferably in the payments business such as Mastercard, Visa, American Express, is a plus).
* You have a strong network within the financial sector in NY and the surrounding areas.
* You have already closed large and complex sales deals exceeding $10 million.
* You have enterprise sales experience of over 8 years.
* You are an independent problem solver.
* You have experience working in international organizations (knowledge of carbon markets, climate policy, etc., is a nice-to-have).
 **Disclaimer**: At Climeworks, we carefully consider market indicators to determine the compensation model for our positions. The salary range has been set by factors such as function, career level, and location and therefore may vary. The US base salary for this full-time position is typically $130,000-$160,000. Within this range, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. We use the recruitment process to determine your career level, job-related skills, and depth of experience to make an informed and fair salary offer.  

  

  



  

**What We Offer:**


At Climeworks, we foster a positive, purpose-driven, and inclusive culture. We care about the well-being of our Climeworkers and offer:


* Paid time off, including vacation.
* Flexibility to occasionally work remotely and adjust working hours.
* RSUs, making you a shareholder in our company.
* A competitive 401k plan and comprehensive health insurance, including dental coverage for you and your dependents.
* A horizontal organization, a supportive team, and a dynamic, innovation-focused environment.
  

You will join a horizontal organization, a great team, an improvement-oriented approach, and a scale-up venture with an innovative technology. Sounds like you? We are looking forward meeting you! Apply now by filling in the online application form and uploading your complete dossier to our careers portal: **https://www.climeworks.com/careers**  



  

**Diversity and Inclusion**:


At Climeworks, we celebrate diversity and encourage everyone to apply. All qualified applicants are considered for positions, so bring along your knowledge, personal experiences, and fresh perspectives, and together we can make a difference.  

  



  

We don’t accept candidate profiles from agencies for our positions.

title: General Maintenance
description:
**The Crystal Springs Resort General Mechanic will monitor and maintain building equipment and structures. The essential functions of the position include:**

* Maintains, repairs and improves all operations of the property. Property includes hotel rooms, pools, kitchens, sports club and all of the spaces, mechanics, furnishings and equipment required for these operations
* Troubleshoots equipment using proper tools in a skilled craftsman-like manner throughout the Resort
* Performs assignments as directed
* Handles routine calls
* Completes daily logs for every shift worked to inform management team of all work performed
* Makes daily rounds of property to ensure smooth operation of all equipment and repairs malfunctioning mechanic devices
* This position works within a team environment
* Must be able to interact with guests and co-workers in a professional, friendly and service-oriented manner
* Must have the ability to respond to and interact appropriately with guests and team members
* Respond positively and quickly to guests’ concerns and correct potential challenges before they affect guests
* Promotes positive guest, employee, and public relations at all times
* Responsible for the quality, consistency, and presentation of all guest rooms, grounds, mechanics and services delivered to guests
* Responsible for the security of any assigned keys/master keys
* Assists in other projects and handles job tasks as deemed appropriate.
* Attends meetings as necessary
* Follows procedures to maintain the safety and security of all team members, guests, and company assets (equipment, supplies)
* Meets attendance guidelines and maintains regular attendance, as required by scheduling, which will vary according to the needs of the hotel
* Ensures that all equipment and work environment is kept clean and in excellent working condition

**Requirements:**

* This position requires a thorough knowledge of a specialized or technical field. May compile objective or measurable data and produce reports. May require operating knowledge of manufacturing or computer equipment. Should have a working ability with general mechanics, including light carpentry & electrical, HVAC, heating, plumbing, grounds maintenance, etc.
* High school diploma
* Minimum of one year experience
* This position requires a valid driver's license at the time of hire

**Working Condition and Physical Effort:**

* The workload required to perform this job requires the ability to adapt to change Significant portions of daily assignments involve application of manual skills requiring motor coordination in combination with finger, e.g. typing, handwriting, or machine operations
* Significant portions of daily assignments involve prolonged standing, transporting material or equipment, lifting or moving, or carrying heavy (over 30 pounds) materials for intermittent periods throughout the day Significant portions of daily assignments involve exposure to dirt, odors, noise, temperature/weather extremes. Working surfaces may be unlevel, slippery, or unstable
* Work regularly requires or varies between the day, evening, night, holiday, or weekend assignments. Schedule varies according to business demands and needs
* Significant portions of daily assignments involve occupational risk, such as cuts, burns, exposure to toxic chemicals, injuries from falls, or back injury sustained with assisting with moving, lifting or positioning equipment or materials
* Significant portions of daily assignments involve ergonomic risk, such regular repetitive tasks, forceful prolonged exertions of the hands, vibration, cold temperatures, heavy lifting, pulling, pushing, or carrying of heavy objects, poor body mechanics, restrictive workstations, or awkward postures
* Must adhere to all safety policies and procedures
* Requires travel to other locations within the resort

**Enjoy Crystal Springs Employee Perks!**

* Discounted Minerals Sports Club Membership
* 30% Dining/Retail Discount
* 30% Spa Discount
* Discounted Stays at the Hotels
* Discounted admission to Events & Festivals
* Complimentary Golf

title: Part-Time Night Auditor/Front Desk Agent
description:
We are seeking a fun, warm, energetic, service-oriented individuals to join our front desk team as a Front Desk Night Auditor. The ideal Front Desk Night Auditor candidate has a natural passion for delivering an authentic message and possesses a great attention to detail and professionalism.

Requirements includes but not limited to, greet, register, and assign rooms to guests of the hotel.

We are currently seeking part-time position (weekends ONLY shift)

Responsibilities:  
- Greet and welcome guests upon arrival  
- Check guests in and out of the hotel  
- Provide information about hotel facilities, services, and local attractions  
- Answer phone calls and respond to guest inquiries  
- Assist with reservations and room assignments  
- Handle guest complaints or concerns with empathy and professionalism  
- Process payments and maintain accurate records  
- Collaborate with other hotel departments to ensure guest satisfaction

- Perform simple bookkeeping activities, such as balancing receipts and revenues for the day, and perform income audit on all revenues posted (i.e., calculating restaurant checks and telephone charges to ensure proper revenues have been posted) prior to closing the day.

- Review accounts and charges with guests during the checkout 6. Make and confirm reservations.

Skills:  
- Strong phone systems skills  
- Exceptional customer service abilities  
- Multilingual proficiency is a plus  
- Excellent phone etiquette  
- Knowledge of guest relations principles and practices  
- Familiarity with night audit procedures is preferred  
- Basic understanding of hospitality industry standards  
- Strong problem-solving skills and ability to handle difficult situations with composure  
- Proficient in using front desk software and computer systems

Note: This position requires hotel experience front desk experience.

Please submit your resume highlighting your relevant experience in the hospitality industry. We look forward to reviewing your application!

title: Medical Assistant Training Provided
description:
**NO EXPERIENCE NECESSARY FOR OUR MEDICAL ASSISTANT APPRENTICE PROGRAM. COMPENSATION STARTS AT $18.00/HOUR THEN INCREASES TO $21.00/HOUR AFTER THE TRAINING PROGRAM ENDS (PROGRAM IS APPROXIMATELY ONE MONTH). POSITION AVAILABLE IN EATONTOWN WITH TRAVEL TO FREEHOLD AS NEEDED (TRAVEL REIMBURSEMENT). SCHEDULE IS FULL-TIME: MONDAYS THROUGH FRIDAYS, 40 HOURS PER WEEK PLUS OVERTIME AS NEEDED.** 

**JOB TITLE:** Medical Assistant

**GENERAL SUMMARY OF DUTIES:** Medical Assistant is responsible for assisting the providers in preparing patients for office visits and documenting and refilling prescriptions as directed by the provider

**ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:**

**Non-Nuclear Duties:**

· Prepare exam rooms for patients and escort patients to exam rooms, obtain vitals, record and review accuracy of medication lists, allergies and patient’s pharmacy. Update patient’s face sheet in EMR.

· Perform EKGs and protimes

· Ensure protime patients have follow-up appointments

· Monitor EMR Work Flow Tasks and complete

· Fill prescription requests following office procedures

· Assist the provider with patient education

· Provide results of lab reports to RN, Nurse Practitioner, or Physician per protocol

· INR data entry, Alere INR results, and call patients with normal INR results

· Assist physicians with EMR documentation

· Perform other duties as assigned

**Nuclear Duties:**

* Monitor stress schedule and report changes to Nuclear Medicine technologists.
* Condense and fill schedules
* Ensure patient consent is obtained
* Perform pregnancy tests as appropriate
* Prepare patient for specific tests to be performed
* Monitor blood pressures throughout testing
* Confirm patients 2 - 3 days prior to testing and record weights for ordering doses.
* Prepare paperwork for the week.
* Fax completed copies of the Daily Noninvasive Cardiac Procedure Log to the billing office
* Call patients to verify insurance deductibles two weeks before appointment
* Ensure lab is fully stocked daily
* Perform other Medical Assistant duties as assigned

**EDUCATION:** High school diploma or GED

**EXPERIENCE**: Prefers a minimum of one year medical office experience

**REQUIREMENTS**: Adherence to all policies and procedures, including confidentiality, safety, performance, attendance, punctuality, and personal grooming and appearance. Ability to read, understand, and follow oral and written instructions. Ability to speak and write in a professional, courteous, and concise manner. Accept and utilize feedback and constructive criticism.

**SKILLS**:

· Excellent interpersonal, typing, and organizational skills

· Excellent use of computers, printers, telephones, fax machines, and other office equipment

· Ability to multi-task, be detail oriented, problem solve, and prioritize responsibilities

· Work well both independently and as a team member

· Strong knowledge of medical terminology

· Demonstrate efficient use of time and equipment and ensure work is accurate and of high quality

· Establish and maintain effective working relationships with patients, colleagues, physicians, and the public

· Successfully manage interactions with challenging or difficult people

**PHYSICAL/MENTAL DEMANDS**: Requires sitting; standing; walking; patient assistance, i.e., lifting and positioning; hand dexterity for telephone, computer and equipment use; normal vision, speaking, and hearing.

**ENVIRONMENTAL WORKING CONDITIONS**: Medical office environment. Work may be stressful at times. Interaction with others is constant and interruptive.

**This description is intended to provide only basic guidelines for meeting job requirements. Essential functions, education, experience, requirements, skills, physical/mental demands, and working conditions may change as needs change.**

title: Lead Architect
description:
**(Location: Remote US)**  

  

**About the role:**



We are looking for a Lead Architect to be responsible for architecting, designing and developing our next generation of Gen AI API platform that supports multiple modalities like image, video, language, 3D and audio. The ideal candidate will have experience in architecting and building REST APIs, hosting AI/ML workflows on HPC cluster, setting up AWS infrastructure and being a mentor for junior developers.


**Responsibilities:**


* Tech lead to drive architecture, design and develop AI/ML SAAS services and set up inference on an HPC cluster for multiple modalities on a common Gen AI platform.
* Build robust application backends on AWS infrastructure that support highly available AI/ML services at high scale that efficiently uses GPU clusters.
* Define comprehensive API specifications and documentation
* Deliver customer-facing services, including account management, identity, single-sign-on, subscription billing, and self-service support tools, integrating with existing internal systems where necessary
* Collaborate with stakeholders like frontend team, product managers and technical leadership to implement new features.
* Lead system architecture design & decisions and help drive consensus.
* Manage large compute clusters for ML inference and development
* Deliver and manage our developer and researcher productivity tools, including CI/CD pipelines for deploying new machine learning models, orchestration, continuous/progressive deployments, test environments, feature flags, and GitHub
* Own the orchestration, deployments, middleware and any other micro services that are required to meet the needs of our API customers


**Qualifications:**


* 10+ years of experience in building REST APIs and backend infrastructure on AWS.
* Experienced in designing and building AI/ML infrastructure and working with large GPU clusters preferably in multiple modalities like image, video, audio, and language.
* Distributed system architecture design knowledge and experience with delivering high traffic and highly available SAAS type services.
* Well-versed in data structures, data modeling, and database management systems, billing and metering, as well as object and file storage systems.
* Experienced in mentoring other engineers and collaborating and working with multiple stakeholders.
* Experienced in root cause analysis and driving operational excellence initiatives of AI/ML services
* Highly proficient in Python and Typescript


**Compensation**



The salary range for this role is between $190,000 and $250,000. Individual pay within the range is based on factors like job-related skills and experience. Total compensation also includes stock options and benefits


**Equal Employment Opportunity:**



We are an equal opportunity employer and do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, veteran status, disability or other legally protected statuses.

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
**Stefanini Group is hiring!**

Exciting opportunity awaits, let us help you get started!

Click or you may call: 248 263 8623 / email: Mariateresa.paje@stefanini.com for faster processing!

Stefanini Group is hiring for an **Administrative Assistant** for a key client of ours.in New Jersey. This is a hybrid role and duties may vary based on onsite location or working remotely. This position performs administrative/clerical functions/tasks necessary to support the Department /Group with in the organization that are diverse and may be sensitive or confidential in nature. Providing high quality administrative and clerical support to various levels of management and handling various routine / non-routine assignments, projects or other related administrative type matters. Also provides back up support in the absence of other administrative positions.

**Responsibilities:**

* Collaboration for meetings, preparing letters, tracking travel expenses, submitting job postings, maintain personal files, ordering supplies and assets
* Hybrid work schedule: 2 in-person days per week one in Clifton NJ and one in Trenton NJ, then 1 remote day per week
* Maintaining files, updating departmental lists, tracking deadlines, all aspects of correspondence, organizing and facilitating conferences and meetings, processing expense reports, ensuring timely file close-outs and receives and processes incoming mail
* Assisting with payroll
* Maintaining team calendar
* Works independently and as a member of cross-functional teams on confidential, time sensitive assignments using judgment and initiative.
* Prepare, proofread and edit documents for accuracy and completeness.
* Perform clerical duties that include typing and filing.
* Screen, direct and prioritize incoming correspondence and phone calls to appropriate parties.
* Maintain and coordinate calendars.
* Responsible for time administration, management of work orders, invoicing, maintaining schedules and facility compliance commitment tracking, maintaining personnel records, including absenteeism and vacations
* Research issues and prepare summaries, memos and other necessary documents, as needed
* Draft, proofread and edit documents as necessary
* Create or maintain databases
* Act as a liaison between internal and external stakeholders, as needed
* Identify needs and gaps within the organization related to administrative activities and partner closely with the team to suggest solutions/project resource and research vendors, programs, etc.
* Provide assistance to new employees through the onboarding process
* Maintain and handle confidential information with discretion
* Provide backup coverage to other administrative support within the Utility or other organizations¸ as needed
* Perform Cross-departmental support in a matrixed environment (e.g., 50% Gas and 50% Customer Care)
* Process customer payments (e.g. stage payments for engineered solutions), perform invoice review and verification (e.g. customer calls, detailed invoice line item checks, etc)
* Work off hours during emergent conditions
* Perform other work-related duties as assigned
* 5 + years of experience in a similar Admin/Clerical role
* Fluent in Microsoft applications
* Knowledge of SAP is a bonus
* Basic knowledge of payroll terminology
* Some basic knowledge of Ariba
* Strong organizational and time management skills, with strong attention to detail and solid ability to take ownership of multiple projects and requests
* Excellent oral & written communication and interpersonal skills with demonstrated ability to interact effectively and work well with individuals at all levels of the organization
* Write clearly and informatively; edits work for spelling and grammar, varies writing style to meet needs, able to read and interpret written information
* Must have the ability to work well under pressure, meet deadlines and identify and resolve problems in a timely manner
* Strong overall administrative skills including, time administration, travel, expense reports, copying, scanning and coordination of filing
* Solid knowledge of Microsoft Office and various software applications, Knowledge of Word, Excel and PowerPoint.
* Willingness to learn new processes, procedures and software applications
* The ability to work independently and effectively handle multiple tasks simultaneously under pressure, completing assignments with close attention to detail and in a thorough, accurate and timely manner.
* Strong customer/client focus and teamwork skills.
* Must be a self-starter who is detailed-oriented, and has strong organizational skills and the ability to work independently with a high degree of accuracy scheduling in-person meetings, WebEx and skype meetings, conference calls, as necessary and have strong follow-up skills.
* Must maintain a high degree of confidentiality and be able to effectively communicate
* Candidate must foster an inclusive work environment and respect all aspects of diversity. Successful candidate must demonstrate and value differences in others' strengths, perspectives, approaches, and personal choices
* Candidate will be required to work off hours during emergent conditions

title: Clinical Manager - Adolescent Substance Use Program
description:
**Job Summary**

**The Division of Services for Addiction of the Montefiore Medical Center is the largest medical school affiliated treatment program in the United States. Our program provides comprehensive substance abuse treatment along with on-site medical and psychiatric healthcare for over 3,500 patients.**

We are seeking a Clinical Manager (LCSW/LMHC/LMFT) with expertise in the treatment of adolescent substance use disorders to join our team in our innovative Adolescent Substance Use Program. The program aims to utilize addiction medication and evidence based psychosocial interventions including CRAFT and contingency management to treat adolescents, young adults, and their parents.

**Qualifications and Skills**

Candidates with an LCSW, LMHC or LMFT with experience conducting group and individual therapy with this population will be strongly considered. The program has been commended by state representatives for providing comprehensive services utilizing empirically validated techniques to an underserved population of substance users in the Bronx.

title: Development Associate
description:
The Development Associate provides administrative support to the Executive Director of Development and other members of the Development team. The ideal candidate will be a highly organized and efficient individual with excellent communication and interpersonal skills. This position interfaces with the public and many of the organization's stakeholders such as Board members, Board assistants, government, private funders, and the Leadership Team.



To succeed in this position, the successful candidate will be exceptionally organized, detail oriented, and will have the judgement to prioritize and make administrative decisions quickly to keep things moving in a dynamic environment.


**Minimum Qualifications/Knowledge**


* Must be computer proficient in Microsoft Office software
* *Experience with* *Raiser's Edge* *or other donor databases a plus*

* Bachelor's Degree


**Skills**


* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Superior organizational skills and the ability to manage a variety of projects
* Accuracy and meticulous attention to detail are essential
* Interest in fundraising, special events and love of animals are desirable.

* Process Donor Acknowledgment Letters and tribute cards, and coordinate staff acknowledgments for honor donations including personalized thanks for donors of gifts between $500-$999. Post and process donation contributions under the supervision of the Development Operations Manager.
* Assist with the drafting and execution of donor correspondence, including Board acknowledgements.
* Answer main development phone line – accepting contributions over the phone and helping with other inquiries as needed.
* Track donor appointments daily and send out afternoon and morning email alerts for the donors who will be in for an appointment.
* Assist with Development Department special events, including list management, invitation mailings, RSVP follow-up, and donor acknowledgement letters.
* Assist with creation and distribution of donor communications such as newsletters, annual reports, and invitations.
* Maintain Development office organization, which includes data entry, filing and managing and ordering all office supply needs. Help to create and employ systems as identified and needed. Process department invoices and reimbursements.
* Assist with any department projects as needed.
* Other duties as assigned.

  


**Benefits Package Includes**


* Competitive salary
* Generous paid time off
* 50% discount on veterinary care
* Continuing education funds with rollover options
* 403(b) matching
* Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage
* You may be eligible for The Public Loan Service Forgiveness Program as we are a 501(c)(3) nonprofit employer


**AMC's Commitment to Lifelong Learning**
-----------------------------------------



The Schwarzman Animal Medical Center is located in Manhattan, near a multitude of leading research and teaching hospitals. AMC's commitment to compassionate and pioneering veterinary care dates to 1910 when it was founded as a clinic to help animals whose owners could not afford treatment. We continue this legacy today as the world's largest non-profit animal hospital, with 130+ veterinarians working collaboratively across 20 specialties and services. Our team prides itself on delivering world class veterinary care to help keep pet families together.



When you join the team at AMC, you join a renowned team of veterinary professionals dedicated to innovative care, research, and education. Our prestigious postgraduate education programs attract future leaders in veterinary medicine, and the clinical research conducted at AMC has led to breakthroughs that change the way veterinary care is delivered industry wide. This shared commitment to learning, teaching, and innovative care creates a collegial, collaborative environment with rewarding opportunities for advancement and growth.



We're building the future of veterinary medicine at the Schwarzman Animal Medical Center, thanks to our transformative Gift of Love campaign to expand and enhance our clinical, educational, and research capacities. Construction is currently underway to fully renovate the hospital, ensuring AMC is at the forefront of veterinary medicine for generations to come.
company_description: The Schwarzman Animal Medical Center is the world’s largest non-profit animal hospital with 100+ veterinarians providing the highest quality medical care across more than 20 specialties and services.

title: Business Systems Application Manager
description:
We are seeking an experienced business analyst as the point person in our growing organization responsible for our resorts business systems. In this position, you will analyze existing systems, identify areas of improvement, recommend new systems and business processes. Responsibility in this position also include creating timelines and project management.

**Essential Functions:**

* Excellent interpersonal skills and solid communication with all levels of management and end users.
* Determine operational objectives by studying business functions and gathering information.
* Compile objectives for improving and streamlining company procedures related to business practices and systems.
* Analyze and recommend computer software solutions by understanding our business requirements. Constructing
* workflow charts and diagrams; studying system capabilities; writing specifications.
* Improve systems by studying current business practices.
* Recommend controls by identifying deficient areas. Writing improved procedures.
* Define project requirements by identifying project milestones, phases, and elements. Form project team(s) and
* establishing a project budget.
* Provide references for users by writing and maintaining user documentation; providing help desk support and end user
* training.
* Analyze existing data. Suggest data cleanup options
* Identify underutilized, misconfigured or limitations of existing systems. Understand interface technologies joining individual systems.

**Requirements:**

Crystal Springs Resort utilizes the following software solutions. The ideal candidate will have prior experience with one or more of the following:

* Agilysys InfoGenesis food and beverage and retail point of sale system.
* Maestro Property Management Systems, Maestro Activities, Maestro SPA & Retail, Maestro Sales & Catering.
* Craftable inventory and procurement system.

* High school diploma or another graduate certificate.

title: Per Diem MRI Tech
description:
**Princeton Orthopaedic Associates** is currently seeking a **Per Diem MRI Technologist**. We are seeking a highly skilled and detail-oriented Per Diem MRI Technologist to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a strong foundation in physiology and anatomy, as well as a commitment to providing exceptional patient care. This position is responsible for operating MRI equipment, performing MRI scans, and maintaining a sterile environment. We have MRI suites located in Princeton and Monroe.

Responsibilities include:

- Perform MRI scans on patients of various ages and medical conditions.  
- Prepare patients for scans, including positioning, padding, and ensuring comfort and safety.  
- Operate MRI equipment to capture high-quality images.  
- Utilize medical terminology to communicate with patients and healthcare providers.  
- Review patient histories and medical records to identify potential health risks and adapt scan protocols accordingly.  
- Maintain aseptic technique throughout the scanning process to minimize the risk of infection.  
- Collaborate with radiologists and other medical professionals.  
- Ensure all equipment is functioning properly and perform routine maintenance tasks.  
- Follow strict safety protocols to minimize exposure to radiation and other potential hazards.  
- Keep accurate records of patient scans and maintain a clean and organized work environment.

Experience:

- At least 2 years of experience as an MRI Technologist.  
- Certification in MRI technology, such as the American Registry of Magnetic Resonance Imaging Technologists (ARMRIT) or the American Registry of Radiologic Technologists (ARRT).  
- A degree in Radiologic Technology or a related field.  
- Strong knowledge of physiology and anatomy, as well as medical imaging principles.  
- Ability to lift, move, or assist patients of varying weights and sizes.  
- Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.  
- A commitment to providing exceptional patient care and maintaining a safe and sterile environment.

Job Type: Part-time

Work Location: In person

title: Residential Instructor
description:
**Residential Instructor**


$18.50/hour.


We are looking for dedicated and caring people to work with adult aged individuals with developmental/intellectual disabilities. If you are passionate about helping others and making a positive impact in the world, we encourage you to apply today!

**About our Company**:


STAR, Inc., is a non-profit located in Norwalk, CT that provides support services to adult aged individuals with developmental/intellectual disabilities and their families for over 70 years. This takes many different forms but all with the same goal of improving the lives of those we serve. We help the individuals we support become the fullest versions of themselves through the values of inclusion, independence, and freedom of choice.

**A Day in the Life of a Residential Instructor:**


As a residential instructor you would start every shift ready to help those we serve live their life as independently as possible. You would assist with activities of daily living such as administering medication, cooking meals, performing personal hygiene, transportation to medical appointments, day program and activities.


You also assist in the implementation of individual behavioral plans. Using effective teaching and mentoring techniques, you teach them new skills and help them achieve goals. Based on each individual's preferences and behavioral plans, you encourage their interests and drive them to community outings and recreational activities. You are happy to help them find greater access to the community. You are conscientious about reporting any concerns about their health and safety and keeping documentation accurate and up-to-date.


While you accomplish all of this you will know that you have profoundly impacted the lives of people you serve in ways both large and small. Every shift you work you have a chance to make a difference!

**Qualifications for the Job:**

* High School Diploma or its equivalent
* A valid driver's license and eligible for a Public Passenger Endorsement
* Compassion and ability to see the potential in everyone
* Positivity and a team-player attitude

**Schedule**:


We operate 24-hour residential group homes which means our Residential Instructors have many shift options including mornings, afternoons, evenings, overnights, and weekends. Full and Part Time is available.

**How to Apply:**


If you would like to be part of a caring and driven team. APPLY TODAY! Quick 5-minute application process.


STAR, Inc., is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Community Support Specialist
description:
**Community Support Specialist**


$18.50/hour. Full Time


We are looking for dedicated and caring people to work with adult aged individuals with developmental/intellectual disabilities in a day program setting. If you are passionate about helping others and making a positive impact in the world, we encourage you to apply today!

**About our Company**:


STAR, Inc., is a non-profit located in Norwalk, CT that provides support services to adult aged individuals with developmental/intellectual disabilities and their families. This takes many different forms but all with the same goal of improving the lives of those we serve. We help the individuals we support become the fullest versions of themselves through the values of inclusion, independence, and freedom of choice.

**A Day in the Life of a Community Support Specialist:**


As a Community Support Specialist, you play a vital role in helping the individuals we support. Our staff will provide support to individuals participating in various community activities. This could be by actively engaging with our participants in an art class, a cooking class, a sporting activity - really anything our individuals choose to participate in.


When not out in the community, you would be in our day program with lunch or activities on-site. Our staff also assist with feeding and personal needs of our participants when needed. You would also drive a company vehicle with assigned participants to and from activities and, if necessary, private family homes for pick-ups or drop offs. At the end of each day, you would leave knowing you've been instrumental in enriching the lives of our participants!

**Qualifications for the Job:**

* High School Diploma or its equivalent
* A valid driver's license and eligible for a Public Passenger Endorsement
* Compassion and ability to see the potential in everyone
* Positivity and a team-player attitude

**Schedule**:


Monday-Friday: 35 hours/week (Paid lunch while supervising participants)

 **Are you ready to Join Our Team?**


If you would like to be part of a caring and driven team. APPLY TODAY! Quick 5-minute application process.

title: Manager of Business Development - New York
description:
**About us:**



Forge Health is a mission-driven outpatient mental health and substance use provider dedicated to providing the highest quality, affordable, and effective "one-stop-shop" care to individuals, families, and communities in need. As the first and only behavioral healthcare provider with a proven, national payer-validated ability to drive clinical outcomes that span all areas of health, Forge Health is leading the charge in driving innovation, improving care delivery, and shaping the future of behavioral health care.



For the third consecutive year, were thrilled to share that Forge Health has been recognized on the prestigious Inc. 5000 list of the fastest-growing private companies in America– a remarkable honor that is a testament to our team's relentless commitment to our mission. If you're passionate about building a great business that makes a difference and working alongside sharp, dedicated, and entrepreneurial individuals, then Forge Health is the right fit for you. Come join us!


**Who we're looking for:**



The **Manager of Business Development** will be responsible for leading the development and continuous growth of Forge Health's business development plan and presence across several clinics in New York. This role requires 3-4 days of travel per week and will be responsible for expanding censuses for all existing and future Forge Health facilities in New York.  

  

Please note, the successful candidate for this opportunity will ideally be located in Westchester County, Manhattan, or Long Island.



At Forge Health, this mission of serving this community is personal for us. We want someone to join us who is passionate about behavioral health and ready to work alongside community partners to change lives. Because the life-saving care we provide is so critical, this individual must have a commitment to excellence and ensure that each partnership established keeps the client at the center. The ideal candidate will have the ability to effectively communicate Forge Health's unique value proposition to a variety of audiences, with strong time management, administrative, and organizational skills, and the ability to prioritize among competing opportunities.  

  

Compensation range: $75-95k, this salary range reflects total compensation, which includes base compensation and bonus potential, however it is not inclusive of benefits and other company perks. Exact compensation may vary based on skills, experience, and location.


**What you'll be doing:**


* Drive growth in client census for all Forge Health clinical programs across designated clinics in New York.
* Collaborate with payers, health systems, provider groups, and other strategic partners to expand access to care through collaborative care and referral relationships.
* Serve as the primary liaison between Forge Health and its partners to ensure all ongoing needs are met, maintaining a strong focus on the client experience.
* Partner with the Head of Corporate Strategy and Development to create and execute growth strategies within existing communities and develop market entry strategies for new communities.
* Regularly assess the effectiveness of business development initiatives against market dynamics and adjust strategies as needed.
* Represent Forge Health at conferences, trade shows, and community events to build awareness and foster partnerships.
* Conduct comprehensive market research to identify trends, opportunities, and competitive landscape.
* Utilize CRM and EMR systems in coordination with Clinical Teams to ensure accurate documentation and adhere to legal requirements.
* Provide leadership, training, and support to team of Outreach Coordinators to achieve market and clinic goals.
* Ensure compliance with all job-specific responsibilities, organizational policies, and procedures.


**What you'll need:**


* Minimum Bachelor's Degree or equivalent
* Minimum of three (3) years of job-related experience with existing accounts
* Working knowledge of health care environments, clinical terminology, and health information systems
* Must have a valid state license and access to a vehicle

**Why Forge?**


**The opportunity:**



Our team refuses to compromise on integrity, and we look for talented, driven hard workers who hold the same passion for the pursuit of high quality, evidence-based mental health and substance use care that we do. Our collective passion is driven and embodied by our core values:


* *Fulfilling:* Our work creates lives that are complete and self-actualized, enabling stronger families and communities – and a therapeutic community rewarded by success
* *Optimistic:* Our passionate positivity and empathy overcome setbacks and get you to your goals, scientifically and humanely
* *Reciprocal:* Without mutual trust and commitment, there can be no progress
* *Grateful:* We profoundly recognize and appreciate the trust of our patients and the commitment of our clinicians
* *Evidence-Based:* We are committed to measurable outcomes, which provide confidence to our patients and creates a standard of care for ourselves and others


**The package:**



At Forge, our people are our greatest asset. We're collaborative, empathetic, and passionate. We learn from our mistakes, we carve out time to breathe, and we are celebrated for our wins. In short, we know that we can't do what we do without you! So, we designed a comprehensive, competitive benefits package that reflects our appreciation of our people:


* Competitive salary aligned with your experience
* Comprehensive paid time off package
* Annual time off to volunteer
* Parental leave
* Annual continuing education allocations
* Competitive medical, dental, and vision package
* Annual subscription to a leading meditation app
* An environment that fosters professional development including financing for advanced licensure and certifications
* Internal supervision opportunities
* Dedicated, motivated team and chance to be part of a highly ambitious medical startup
* Modern, elegant, and high-end work environment


We are committed to equal employment opportunity. We give equal consideration to all applicants when filling positions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, actual or perceived disability, genetic information, marital status, and/or any other status not related to an applicant's ability to perform the job duties. All employment practices will be carried out in accordance with federal, state and local laws.  

We will also fully comply with regulations and requirements set out by the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) and the ADA amendments Act (ADAAA). We will not discriminate against applicants or other individuals with real or perceived disabilities. When needed, we will provide reasonable accommodation to otherwise qualified candidates so that they are able to perform the essential functions of the position.

title: Addiction Counselor (MHC/MFT,CASAC)
description:
The Division of Services for Addiction of Montefiore Medical Center provides comprehensive substance abuse treatment along with on-site medical and psychiatric healthcare for over 4,000 patients. The program has been commended by state representatives for providing comprehensive services utilizing empirically validated techniques to an underserved population of patients with substance use disorders in the Bronx.

**Responsibilities and Duties**

**We are looking to hire dedicated counselors** to join our innovative substance abuse treatment programs. Job responsibilities include providing individual and group substance abuse counseling and maintaining clinical documentation. This is an excellent opportunity for socially minded individuals interested in helping an underserved population

**Qualifications and Skills**

**Requirements** Candidates with a Master’s Degree in Psychology, Mental Health Counseling (MHC), or Marriage and Family Therapy (MFT)degrees with one year of experience conducting group and individual therapy will be strongly considered to be part of our Division. Spanish is preferred and CASAC credential is a plus. You will be provided training and supervision in clinically validated treatments and supervision is provided by experienced social workers (LCSWs) or Licensed Mental Health Counselors (LMHC). Must have an active License, Limited Permit or CASAC/CASAC-T.

**Benefits**

The position has a competitive salary and benefits (1199 Union Position) including excellent tuition reimbursement.

This position is also eligible for Loan Repayment through the National HealthService Corps for fully licensed clinicians(https://nhsc.hrsa.gov/loan-repayment/eligibility/index.html).

title: Crystal Structure Prediction Scientist
description:
We're seeking a **Crystal Structure Prediction Scientist** to join us in our mission to discover and develop drugs that improve human health and materials that increase quality of life!


Schrödinger is a leading provider of advanced molecular simulations and enterprise software solutions that accelerate and increase the efficiency of drug discovery and materials design. Schrödinger has a growing pipeline of early stage assets and has co-founded leading biotech companies, including Nimbus Therapeutics and Morphic Therapeutic. In addition, the company has deep partnerships and collaborations in such fields as biotechnology, pharmaceuticals, chemicals, and electronics. Through significant long-term investments in basic research, Schrödinger has made scientific breakthroughs across many areas of drug discovery and materials science.

As a member of our Life Sciences Software team, you'll work with cutting-edge, physics-based technologies in drug discovery and materials design. Your background in computational chemistry, solid state physics, quantum mechanics, and/or free energy calculations will make you a key contributor in our efforts to revolutionize the way therapeutics and materials are discovered.

  

**Who will love this job:**
* A scientist with extensive training in solid state physics, quantum mechanics, and thermodynamics who has practical experience with small molecule crystal structure prediction
* A skilled modeler who understands small molecule crystal structures and property calculations
* A drug formulation expert with excellent verbal and written communication skills
* A proficient Python and/or C++ programmer who's worked in UNIX/Linux environments

**What you'll do:**  

* Facilitate breakthroughs in computer-aided drug discovery and materials design by delivering novel methods with unprecedented levels of accuracy
* Work with a team of scientists and engineers to develop novel methods to accurately predict small molecule crystal structures
* Carefully design computational experiments and collect data to validate the methods and explore applications areas

**What you should have:**  

* PhD in computational chemistry, solid state physics, solid state property modeling, or related fields
* Peer-reviewed publications on crystal structure prediction, solid state property modeling, computational chemistry, and/or materials modeling
* Experience in developing crystal structure prediction methods is highly desired

**Pay and perks:**
Schrödinger understands it's people that make a company great. Because of this, we're prepared to offer a competitive salary, equity-based compensation, and a wide range of benefits that include healthcare (with dental and vision), a 401k, pre-tax commuter benefits, a flexible work schedule, and a parental leave program. We have regular catered meals in the office, a company culture that is relaxed but engaged, and over a month of paid vacation time. Our Office Management team also plans a myriad of fun company-wide events. New York is home to our largest office, but we have teams all over the world. Schrödinger is honored to have been included in Crain's New York Best Places to Work, BuiltIn's NYC Best Place to Work, and Newsweek's list of America's 100 Most Loved Workplaces.

Estimated base salary range (NYC only): $120,000 - $190,000. Actual compensation package is dependent on a number of factors, including, for example, experience, education, degrees held, market data, and business needs. If you have any questions regarding the compensation for this role, do not hesitate to reach out to a member of our Strategic Growth team.

Sound exciting? Apply today and join us!

*As an equal opportunity employer, Schrödinger hires outstanding individuals into every position in the company. People who work with us have a high degree of engagement, a commitment to working effectively in teams, and a passion for the company's mission. We place the highest value on creating a safe environment where our employees can grow and contribute, and refuse to discriminate on the basis of race, color, religious belief, sex, age, disability, national origin, alienage or citizenship status, marital status, partnership status, caregiver status, sexual and reproductive health decisions, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or any other protected characteristic. To us, "diversity" isn't just a buzzword, but an important element of our core principles and key business practices. We believe that diverse companies innovate better and think more creatively than homogenous ones because they take into account a wide range of viewpoints. For us, greater diversity doesn't mean better headlines or public images - it means increased adaptability and profitability.*
company_description: Mission: To improve human health and quality of life by transforming the way scientists design therapeutics and materials.

title: Enrollment Manager - Admissions and Financial Aid
description:
Position Summary: Reporting directly to the Vice President for Admissions and Financial Aid, the Enrollment Coordinator, Admissions and Financial Aid participates in the day-to-day operations of Union Theological Seminary’s admissions and financial aid office, which processes inquiries from prospective students to the Master of Divinity, Master of Arts, Master of Sacred Theology and doctoral programs for a nationally recognized theology program with an enrollment of approximately 250 students. Responsibilities include fielding general admissions and financial inquiries from prospective and current students, following up with incomplete admission and financial aid applications, entering enrollment and financial aid data into the college’s student information system, providing administrative support to the admissions, financial aid and enrollment process, and helping maintain records.

This position will be full time.

**Principal Duties and Responsibilities:**

***Admissions Operations***

* Participate as an active member of the Admissions team assisting in planning and implementing admissions goals.
* Oversee the workflow of recruitment, admission, and enrollment data in the Slate Enrollment CRM system, preparing the system for each upcoming cycle and ensuring efficiency.

1. Evaluate and audit applicant records and transcripts, ensuring all records are accurate and all materials are received. Communicate updates, issues, needs, and other admissions-related information to prospective students.

2. Under the director of the VP of Admissions and Financial Aid, provide reports to key stakeholders in other departments, including Registrar, Student Affairs, Online Learning, Communications and Development.

3. Manage accurate data exports to our student information system (Jenzabar SONIS, OnBase) and data imports from relevant systems (Raiser’s Edge, NetCommunity, etc).

4. Oversee set-up, assignment, and communication of student credentials for incoming students 5. Help prepare marketing, recruitment, admissions, and enrollment reports and surveys as directed, ensuring data is accurate and useful.

* As a key member of the Admissions team, provide student-centered, excellent customer service, welcoming students, faculty, and staff in person and through telephone and email

1. Respond to daily mail, email, telephone, and in-person requests from prospective students. Provide prospective students with guidance on completing admission, financial aid, and other related enrollment paperwork by assessing needs and asking appropriate questions.

2. Communicate with all applicants that have started the application process about application components, timelines, and procedures and update them on what components we have received.

3. Receive enrollment documents submitted by students (applications, transcripts, test scores, financial aid supporting documents, etc.), evaluate for completion, and forward to counterparts in the Registrar’s or Academic Office as needed.

* In conjunction with the admissions team and other stakeholders, support the development of multimedia communications to serve the needs of our enrollment and recruitment efforts.
* In conjunction with the Associate Director of Marketing and Communications and the Assistant Director of Recruitment and Enrollment, configure and monitor enrollment marketing emails in the Slate CRM system
* Upload and maintain prospect lists stemming from event attendance, list purchases, open houses, and other recruitment events. Ensure records are properly coded to facilitate effective communications
* Maintain campus visit and recruitment event portal in Slate, including setting up events and tracking prospect attendance
* Create and distribute event reminders and thank you emails on a regular basis.
* Provide logistical and technical support for virtual recruitment events, including set-up, recording, and distribution of event materials to prospects.
* Support other teams and units looking to leverage Slate to maximize enrollment goals Administrative Support
* Provide general administrative support to the Admissions and Financial Aid Office. Other responsibilities
* Maintain confidentiality of student records by following FERPA regulations, carefully monitoring student records at the workstation for security, and properly store all student records
* Maintain sensitivity, understanding and respect for a diverse academic environment, inclusive of students, faculty, and staff of varying social, economic, cultural, ideological, religious, and ethnic backgrounds
* When needed, participate in campus visitation programs, new student orientations, campus retention programs, and commencement events

***MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:*** Bachelor’s degree required. Two to four years of experience required. Demonstrated accuracy in handling detailed work required. Demonstrated superior customer service and interpersonal skills and excellent written and oral communication skills required. Strong organizational skills required. Must demonstrate strong computer skills. Experience with Slate preferred. Excellent proofreading/editing skills required. Must be able to work under pressure on concurrent projects with frequent interruptions and minimal supervision.

**Submission of a cover letter with a current resume is required.** 

**Salary Range: $60k-$62k** 

Hiring Policy:

Union Theological Seminary, an equal opportunity employer, seeks a racially diverse, broadly representative faculty, staff, and student body that is sensitive to cross cultural issues. The Union Theological Seminary community is diverse not only in race, age, gender, and sexuality, but also in geography, background, perspective, denomination, and even faith traditions. Union is set in the urban environment of New York City, which is a microcosm of the world, a place where the local and the global intersect. The seminary enjoys cooperative relations with other academic, cultural and church institutions in the Morningside Heights/Harlem neighborhood, as well as in the greater New York area and elsewhere.

title: President and CEO
description:
**ORGANIZATION:** Firelight Media  

**POSITION:** President and CEO  

**REPORTS TO:** Board of Directors  

**LOCATION:** New York, NY (hybrid)  

**WEBSITE:** firelightmedia.tv
  

**TO APPLY:** Please send cover letter and resume as one PDF to FirelightPresidentCEO@pbrsearch.com with title format “Last Name First Name – Letter Resume”.


‍

### **BACKGROUND**


Firelight Media was founded by Marcia Smith and Stanley Nelson as an independent nonprofit documentary production company that produced stories on topics typically underrepresented in the mainstream media. In 2008, Firelight Media transitioned to focusing on supporting emerging filmmakers of color, while Firelight Films was launched as the new for-profit production company led by Stanley Nelson. Today, Firelight Media (Firelight) supports the creation, distribution, and impact of documentary media by and about communities of color in all their vibrance and complexity. By providing filmmakers with mentorship, funding, and creative development, Firelight advances the art of nonfiction storytelling to realize a more just and beautiful world. Through a range of programs, Firelight Media provides dynamic support to filmmakers at every step of their creative journey, from research and development, through production and into exhibition, distribution, and impact campaigns. Firelight also produces documentary shorts and runs a series of virtual and in-person panel discussions, film screenings, and commissioned essays about documentaries. The organization currently has a staff of 20 and an operating budget of $6M.


‍

### **POSITION**


The President and CEO will lead the organization at an important moment in its history; Firelight will celebrate its 25th anniversary in 2025 and is seeking a successor to the founding president Marcia Smith, who has grown the organization into a robust artist support organization that is considered a leading voice, community-builder, and advocate for documentary filmmakers of color. This leader will work closely with the staff, board of directors, and external partners to set the strategic direction for Firelight Media’s next chapter. The ideal candidate is a strategic and creative leader who is passionate about the potential of documentary films to create narrative change through compelling storytelling and can ensure that the organization has the systems and resources required to advance its mission for decades to come.


‍

### **RESPONSIBILITIES**

#### **Strategic Leadership**

* Work with key stakeholders, including staff, board members, and funders, to set a strategic direction forFirelight Media’s next chapter and execute it.
* Effectively communicate the organization’s goals both internally and externally so that all stakeholders understand their roles and responsibilities in bringing these ideas to fruition.
* Adapt and align the organizational structures and ways of working as needed to ensure that Firelight Media’s programs, staffing, and budget are financially sustainable and aligned at this time of evolution.
* Define and implement concrete metrics for success for Firelight Media’s programs.
* Build upon and continue Firelight Media’s diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging work.
* Foster an integrated and inclusive work culture rooted in open communication and a shared sense of purpose.  

‍

#### **People Leadership**

* Provide motivational leadership for the team so they are inspired to continue doing exceptional work.
* Ensure team members understand how their specific roles contribute to the overarching mission and purpose of the organization.
* Ensure that the organization has strong leaders in key positions, growing a leadership team in partnership with various departments and programs.
* Work with senior leadership to ensure that Firelight Media has a positive, supportive culture that attracts and retains staff, provides opportunities for professional development, and has robust HR best practices.  

‍

#### **Financial and Operational Leadership**

* Lead the team in a results-focused, data-driven way to achieve strategic objectives.
* Be responsible for the overall fiscal health of Firelight Media, with an eye towards continuing to build long-term sustainability.
* Collaborate with senior team members to ensure that Firelight Media’s operations and finances are aligned with best practices and strategic goals.  

‍

#### **Fundraising and External Relations**

* Working with the Firelight Media board and the development officer, realize a comprehensive fundraising plan to diversify and grow support and ensure continued financial sustainability.
* Be Firelight Media’s lead fundraiser, developing relationships with existing partners and building new relationships in the field.
* Serve as the spokesperson and advocate for Firelight Media’s goals of narrative change through supporting documentary filmmakers of color. To that end, strengthen and sustain relationships with partners, funders, alumni, and the broader public.
* Continue to elevate Firelight Media’s status as a leading resource for documentary filmmakers of color and key player in the documentary landscape.  

‍

#### **Board Relations**

* Work closely with an engaged and active board to determine and evaluate the best path for Firelight Media’s continued growth and relevance.
* Partner with the board to attract, engage, and retain new board members who can help Firelight Media realize its mission and vision.
* Develop strong relationships with each board member, implementing best practices to ensure their contribution to Firelight Media is aligned with their interests and the organization’s needs.  

‍

### **QUALIFICATIONS**

#### **Experience**

* Significant executive leadership experience, with a track record of setting and realizing strategic goals, preferably at a relevant nonprofit (e.g. film, media, storytelling, journalism, social justice, funder)
* Experience and/or understanding of the current opportunities and challenges in independent documentary filmmaking and/or journalism, including emerging trends in the field and ongoing market pressures
* Experience taking an organization/department/program through a period of transition or evolution
* A passion for fundraising from diverse sources, collaborating with an active and engaged board, and building donor relationships; demonstrated success in fundraising strongly preferred
* Superior managerial and interpersonal skills, and experience leading a highly capable staff in ways that emphasize collaboration and teamwork. A track record of leading and inspiring results-oriented teams to meet specific organizational goals
* Experience managing budgets and developing new revenue streams  

‍

#### **Personal Attributes**

* Commitment to Firelight Media’s vision and mission
* Passion for documentary filmmaking and storytelling with an emphasis on narrative change
* Artistic, creative sensibility
* Ability to operate at a high strategic level while being grounded in the work of the team
* Emotionally intelligent; has the ability to authentically engage with people from various backgrounds
* Strong written and verbal communication skills; a persuasive and passionate communication style
* Champions forward-thinking organizational policies that prioritize the well-being of staff
* Leads from a place of humility; open to good ideas wherever they come from  

‍

### **Compensation**

* Anticipated salary range $275K – $290K; commensurate with experience
* Competitive benefits package, including employer-paid health plan, dental, vision, 403(b) contribution match, and generous PTO


‍

***Frequently cited statistics show that women and people from underrepresented groups apply to jobs only if they think they meet 100% of the criteria. If you meet many but not all the criteria and feel you may be a good fit for the role, Firelight Media encourages you to apply.***

***Firelight Media is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of age, color, national origin, ethnic origin, citizenship status, disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law in its employment policies. In addition, Firelight Media will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities.***

title: Laborer/Trainee - Solar Energy
description:
Join our team! Long Island's premier solar energy company is seeking a reliable laborer/helper and solar energy trainee for residential and commercial installations in Nassau and Suffolk counties. Position may be part-time leading to full-time, or full-time depending on the candidate's skills and preferences.

The successful candidate should have an understanding of construction, either carpentry, electrical, roofing or other and possibly prior experience working on a construction site or in a related field. Candidate should demonstrate a willingness to learn and assist solar technicians with equipment deliveries, solar panel and electrical equipment installations, and other construction duties to ensure projects are completed efficiently and to the highest quality at various job sites. Solar industry experience is not necessary, as we provide on-the-job and other training.

This job has great potential for advancement for a person enthusiastic about learning about construction in general and about solar energy in particular to become a key player as part of our team. Most important for this position, the right candidate must report to work on time every day, have positive outlook, be willing to help with varied organizing and laborer tasks. This is a hands-on role that requires a strong work ethic, attention to detail, and the ability to follow instructions.

A valid license and clean driving record is a must to be able to drive company vehicles. A plus for person with own vehicle; will provide mileage reimbursement where applicable.

Duties include but are not limited to:  
- Assist in the installation, maintenance, and repair of solar energy systems, including but not limited to electrical work.  
- Operate power tools and equipment to complete tasks such as solar panel installations on the roof and other general labor tasks.  
- Perform tasks that require physical labor and stamina to perform manual labor tasks, such as lifting, carrying, and moving materials and equipment, usually outdoors.  
- Ensure that all work is done in a safe and responsible manner, following all safety protocols and guidelines.  
- Assist in the cleanup of the construction sites, equipment storage areas and vehicles, and ensure that all materials and equipment are properly inventoried and stored.

All of the above plus other associated duties, as needed. Will be subject to background check. Company policy of no tobacco/vape, and random drug testing.

Please provide a resume when applying.

Celebrating 23 years as Long Island’s solar pioneer, Built Well Solar has been capturing the power of the sun since 2001. Working for our family owned and operated company will offer an opportunity to learn, advance, and grow in a small business setting, a company that is a leader in the local market in a field that is one of the fastest growing in the nation. Built Well Solar consistently ranks as one of the "Top Solar Energy Companies in the U.S." and Better Business Bureau rated A+.

title: Leasing Consultant
description:
**Want to learn more about The Scion Group?** **Check out our website.**



We're hiring immediately!


*We are interested in every qualified candidate who is eligible to work in the United States. However, we are not able to sponsor visas.*

**Your Opportunity**



Scion is paving a path in student living and the Experience Team Member (ETM) is essential to our commitment to exceptional customer experience and strong partnerships within the community. This position combines marketing, relationship building, administration and customer service all in one.



The ETM will thrive in a fast-paced, agile, collegiate environment. This role demands exceptional interpersonal and problem-solving skills and stellar work ethic.


**Your Responsibilities**



Customer Experience & Sales


* Prioritize interactions and communication with customers. Provide community and amenity tours.
* Provide feedback on sales barriers and customer objections to management team.
* Execute sales and engagement initiatives as outlined by management.
* Provide recommendations on local marketing opportunities and messaging.
* Assist with social media and communication on various platforms to engage customers.
* Assist with planning, promoting and executing customer experience initiatives, engagement initiatives, and additional marketing opportunities.
* Always represent the community positively and professionally, both in and out of the office.


Property Administration


* Demonstrate proficiency with general community, market and policy knowledge.
* Log, file and retrieve customer packages.
* Assist with general housekeeping involved with opening, closing and maintaining the office, clubhouse, grounds and amenities.
* Schedule and follow up on maintenance requests to aid in timely resolutions.
* Maintain office organization and cleanliness.
* Assist with after-hours lock out duties as required.


*The responsibilities listed above may not be all inclusive.*


**What We Require**


* Customer-centric mindset
* Agility & flexibility with a frequently changing environment
* Great communication & interpersonal skills with a diverse population
* Reliability & self-discipline
* Availability to work during summer, holidays, and Turn periods


**Operational Details**


* Job location is at the assigned property.
* Working hours consist of daytime business hours and after hour on-call rotation.

  


*The Scion Group LLC provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, creed, national origin, color, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, physical or mental disability (as long as the employee/applicant is otherwise qualified for the job with or without a reasonable accommodation), genetic information, HIV/AIDS status, marital status, uniformed service, veteran status, pregnancy or other legally protected status or category under federal or state law. The Scion Group LLC complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in all locations in which the Company has properties. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfers, leaves of absence, compensation, training and other terms and conditions of employment. The Scion Group LLC is committed to the principles of equal employment opportunities.*

title: Verification Expert
description:
**Help empower our global customers to connect to culture through their passions.**

**Why you'll love this role**



Interested in growing your career on the cutting edge of culture, working for the company selling the hottest brands and products around the world? You will be an integral member of an exciting, hyper-growth company as we continue to expand our operations globally. If you enjoy working in a start-up culture, where ambiguity inspires your creativity, StockX, may be the place for you!



The Verification Expert inspects footwear, streetwear, and collectibles (including but not limited to textiles, electronics, energy categories) to ensure the products meet the standards and conditions of StockX and are authentic. You'll work closely with our operations and customer service teams to deliver an outstanding customer experience.


**What you'll do**


* Inspect and process footwear, streetwear, and collectibles (including but not limited to textiles, electronics, energy categories) adhering to strict standards of condition and verification
* Proactively work with site leadership and other team members to identify process improvements
* Support operations team in inbound and outbound functions as directed and per business needs
* Contribute to the cleanliness standards and processes of the site
* Contribute to and maintain site safety standard


**About you**


* Strong work ethic and positive attitude
* Sense of urgency to perform tasks to timelines
* Comfortable in a fast-paced work environment
* Ability to work well in teams and good communication skills
* Strong attention to detail


**Nice to have skills**


* 0-3 years of experience in assessing value and risk of footwear, streetwear, and collectibles (including but not limited to textiles, electronics, energy categories)
* Fashion retail background

**Working Conditions**
* The Verification Center is a warehouse environment with working conditions found in a typical warehouse setting. Closed toed and closed heel shoes are required. Team members in this environment will be required to stand, walk, bend, stoop, turn, and pivot more than 75% of the time.
* May push, pull, and lift up to 50 pounds (or 23kg); on occasion a team-lift of up to 100 pounds (or 45kg) and may be required to bend, twist, kneel and squat regularly.
* This role may require you to ascend or descend ladders, stairs, ramps, and the like on a frequent basis depending on site location

  


*Pursuant to the various pay transparency laws/acts, the base salary is $18.00/hr plus opportunities for benefits (e.g., medical, dental), equity and discretionary bonuses. Compensation is dependent on geography and may vary.*


*Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance, and any other state or local hiring regulations, we will consider for employment any qualified applicant, including those with arrest and conviction records, in a manner consistent with the applicable regulation.*

 **About Us**
  

StockX is proud to be a Detroit-based technology leader focused on the large and growing online market for sneakers, apparel, accessories, electronics, collectibles, trading cards, and more. StockX's powerful platform connects buyers and sellers of high-demand consumer goods from around the world using dynamic pricing mechanics. This approach affords access and market visibility powered by real-time data that empowers buyers and sellers to determine and transact based on market value. The StockX platform features hundreds of brands across verticals including Jordan Brand, adidas, Nike, Supreme, BAPE, Off-White, Louis Vuitton, Gucci; collectibles from artists including KAWS and Takashi Murakami; and electronics from industry-leading manufacturers Sony, Microsoft, Nvidia, and Apple. Launched in 2016, StockX employs more than 1,000 people across offices and verification centers around the world.  



*We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. This job description is intended to convey information essential to understanding the scope of the job and the general nature and level of work performed by job holders within this job. However, this job description is not intended to be an exhaustive list of qualifications, skills, efforts, duties, responsibilities or working conditions associated with the position. StockX reserves the right to amend this job description at any time.*
