title: Product Operations Analyst
description:
**Alloy is where you belong!**
------------------------------



Alloy is a leader in the fraud prevention space. We help some of the most innovative banks and fastest growing fintech companies grow and scale operations by allowing them to find more good customers and onboard them without increasing the risk of fraud.



Through our values: Be Bold, Get Scrappy, Collaborate, and Celebrate Our Differences, we are creating a workplace where you can grow, thrive, and belong. See how we've been continuously recognized and named one of Inc. Magazine's Best Workplaces, Best Fintech to Work for by American Banker, and Best Place to Work by Built in NYC year after year.



Check out our investors and read more about us here.


**Why we're hiring**
--------------------



We're seeking out a scrappy, metrics-driven product operations analyst to help supercharge Product & Engineering Operations! This role will report to the Senior Technical Chief of Staff and work closely with the CPO, CTO, and P&E leaders. The Product Operations Analyst will be critical in building out the processes and insights that help us to drive efficiency and build a world class product.


**What you'll be doing**
------------------------



The Product Operations Analyst will support all things P&E operations, working both tactically and strategically to make sure everything runs smoothly, while driving improvements in the way we work. This is a great role for someone who loves variety, working cross-functionally, and using a blend of people skills and technical abilities to get a job done. You will partner with leaders and teams throughout the whole organization.



As Product Operations Analyst, you will:


* Improve, manage and socialize our processes for feature requests, bugs and product work.
* Build internal reporting capabilities to create leadership-level visibility into product performance, internal efficiency, and operations.
* Plan and manage recurring team rituals, including offsites, All Hands, Hackathons, etc. Drive iteration on the agenda and goals with feedback from across the organization.
* Work cross-functionally with partners in Finance, Revenue, Marketing, & Professional Services to support various operational needs and build relationships.
* Assist in building a brand new Product Operations function at Alloy, helping set the strategy, culture, and internal storytelling of the way we work.

**Who we're looking for**
-------------------------



We're a lean team, so your impact will be felt immediately with opportunities to grow as the company continues to scale. If this all sounds like a good fit for you, come join our team!


**The ideal candidate:**


* Can build systems and processes to facilitate internal operations.
* Enjoys being scrappy and moving fast, while continuing to iterate for continual improvement.
* Is a great communicator and relationship builder.
* Cares about culture and will be a key influencer in building a high-performing team.


**Candidates for this role should have:**


* 3+ years of relevant project management or analyst experience with a demonstrated track record of accomplishing goals and meeting deadlines.
* Proven problem solving, analytical, and organizational skills.
* Experience working in a technology organization, preferably software and product development, and the ability to work with product and engineering leaders and SMEs.
* Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills, ability to engage with technical and non-technical audiences.
* Experience working in a highly cross-functional environment.


**Nice to haves:**


* Experience with Jira, Pendo, or other engineering or product tooling
* Experience building metrics reporting capabilities for product & engineering teams


We're a lean team, so your impact will be felt immediately with opportunities to grow as the company continues to scale. If this all sounds like a good fit for you, come join our team!



At Alloy, we strive to attract and retain talent with a total rewards program that is competitive with other organizations of our size and stage. We are committed to ensuring each new team member has what they need to be successful in their role with a balanced range of compensation, equity, perks, and benefits. We actively share our philosophy with employees, to foster openness and clarity. Finally, we work to administer our philosophy and drive consistency to promote equity and monitor the fairness of outcomes.


*This position has a starting base salary of $122,000 and a midpoint base salary of $144,000. The base pay may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. In addition to a competitive base salary, this position is also eligible for equity awards in the form of stock options (ISOs).*


**Benefits and Perks**
----------------------


* Unlimited PTO and flexible work policy
* Employee stock options
* Medical, dental, vision plans with HSA (monthly employer contribution) and FSA options
* 401k with 100% match up to 4% of annual employee compensation
* Eligible new parents receive 16 weeks of paid parental leave
* Home office stipend for new employees
* Learning & Development annual stipend
* Well-being benefits include access to OneMedical, Headspace, and more

**How to Apply**
----------------



Apply right here! You've found the application!



Alloy is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and employer. We're committed to equal opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, gender, gender identity, parental or pregnancy status, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or veteran status.

title: Wholesale and Brand Agent
description:
Summary

The Wholesale and Brand Agent will be responsible for driving wholesale sales and managing the brand representation of Fresh Grow LLC across New Jersey. This role involves building relationships with distributors, managing wholesale accounts, ensuring brand consistency, and working closely with marketing to enhance brand awareness. The ideal candidate should have a strong background in branding, sales, and customer relationship management, with the ability to travel for meetings, events, and sales opportunities.

Essential Functions

* **Wholesale Sales**: Develop and manage relationships with distributors and wholesale partners. Identify new sales opportunities and negotiate contracts.
* **Brand Representation**: Ensure the company’s brand is consistently represented across all wholesale channels. Work with the marketing team to create and implement branding strategies.
* **Account Management**: Oversee wholesale accounts, provide exceptional customer service, and ensure clients receive timely deliveries and support.
* **Sales Reporting**: Track and report on sales performance, providing regular updates to the CEO.
* **Travel and Networking**: Travel within New Jersey to meet with potential clients, attend branding events, and network within the cannabis industry to promote the Fresh Grow brand.
* **Compliance**: Ensure that all sales and branding efforts are compliant with state regulations regarding cannabis.
* **Marketing Collaboration**: Collaborate with the marketing team to align sales and branding strategies, ensuring maximum brand visibility.
* **Event Coordination**: Participate in and organize brand events, trade shows, and product launches to promote the company’s offerings.
* **Continuous Improvement**: Identify trends in the market, adjust sales strategies, and suggest improvements to branding approaches.
* **Other Duties**: Perform other related duties as assigned.

Preferred Qualifications and Education Requirements

* Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business, or a related field.
* 3-5 years of experience in wholesale sales, branding, or marketing, ideally within the cannabis or a similar regulated industry.
* Strong communication and relationship-building skills.
* Proficiency in branding and marketing strategies, with a keen eye for detail.
* Ability to work independently and manage multiple accounts and tasks.
* Willingness to travel regularly within New Jersey.
* Proven track record in sales, with the ability to meet and exceed targets.
* Proficiency in CRM software and sales reporting tools.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $40,000.00 - $60,000.00 per year

title: Regional Supervisor (Control Center)
description:
**Regional Supervisor - Control Center**  

  

Move forward with us! At NJ TRANSIT, you'll be joining us in transforming the third-largest transportation agency in North America. We are committed to delivering safe, reliable service that gets our customers to their destinations on time—and we’re looking to hire talented folks with a love of learning to make it all possible.  

  

**Summary**  

Supervise the activities of road operations statewide to identify and address issues to ensure service quality within budget and on-time performance parameters.  

  

**Roles and Responsibilities:**
* Working in the Control Center, assigned to a console, observes and supervises Bus Operations activities to ensure safe and effective delivery of transit services to customers through responsible supervision and effective communication, both verbal and in writing.
* Makes quick and effective decisions, working under intensive time pressures; reacts calmly and professionally in emergency situations; oversees operations as required during emergencies and severe weather conditions. Quickly analyzes a situation and provides a solution.
* Follows procedures in dispatching personnel for emergency and non-emergency response.
* Prepares daily comprehensive reports and correspondence, such as CAD incident report, on-time performance report, log reports, inclement weather reports, etc.
* Communicating with the operator through CAD and a bus radio, troubleshoots mechanical and electronic equipment problems, such as radios, fareboxes, wheelchair lifts, air conditioning and heating, P/A announcements, and other problems, utilizing the Road-Call Reduction Manual.
* Uses information available from CAD system to evaluate service and adjust as necessary to maintain consistent reliable service levels.
* Coordinates with Field Regionals and other NJ TRANSIT departments and outside agencies as required to handle extraordinary events, such as: major fuel spills, major accidents, traffic interruptions, weather conditions, special events, and rail disruptions, and implements contingency plans to bring situation under control.
* Monitors radio sign-on, radio/PA checks, and uses CAD radio communication equipment to communicate information and/or instructions to revenue and non-revenue vehicles.
* Understands all ADA regulations and NJ TRANSIT policies and procedures.
* Responsible for maintaining, reading, and referencing the Standatrd Operations Procedures Manual to understand and perform their duties adequately, reflecting their responsibility towards the Corporate Mission Statement.
* Attend meetings and trainings as required.
* Prepare documents and reports as requested
* Quarterly shift rotation within control center to enhance career development and improve employee knowledge of company operations.


  

**Education, Experience and Qualifications:**  

**Required:**
* High School Diploma or high school equivalency diploma PLUS
* Three (3) years of full time paid work experience in progressively responsible positions; OR
* Three (3) years of full-time experience as a NJTRANSIT Bus Operator OR,
* Associate’s Degree, and one (1) year of full-time paid work experience OR**,**
* Honorable discharge from any branch of the US Military.
* Any equivalent combination of education and experience equal to or greater than three years


**Preferred:**
* Bachelor’s Degree with at least one (1) year of full-time work experience


**Knowledge and Skills:**
* Possess a working knowledge of and ability to adhere to all federal, state law, regulations and NJT policies.
* Excellent organizational and time management skills.
* Possess a working knowledge of common transit practices, equipment, terminology, safety precautions and safety rules.
* Working knowledge of MS Office Suite and transportation specific software and applications.
* Ability to successfully plan, execute, supervise, and inspect the work of others.
* Excellent written and oral communication skills
* Ability to develop and maintain clear, concise and accurate records/activity logs.
* Ability to create and maintain effective and professional working relationships within all levels of the organization.
* Ability to deal with both employees and to customer’s courteously, tactfully, and professionally.
* Ability to identify potentially hazardous conditions and take corrective action to resolve/or remediate.
* Demonstrate good judgment.
* Demonstrated critical thinking, the ability to conceptualize, apply, analyze, synthesize, and/or evaluate information gathered from, or generated by, observation, experience, reflection, reasoning, or communication, as a guide to action and anticipate issues.
* Ability to make quick but well-reasoned operational decisions.
* Show dependability, initiative and resourcefulness.
* Physical condition must be commensurate with the demands of the position.
* Ability to identify potentially hazardous conditions and take corrective action to resolve/or remediate.
* Demonstrate good judgment.

  

**Certificates, Licenses, Registrations:**
* Must possess a valid New Jersey State drivers' license at the time of hire and maintain such license for the duration of employment.
* Within six months of hire must obtain a CDL B permit.
* Within twelve months of employment employee must successfully complete NJT’s supervisory training The Art of Managing People I and II and obtain a CDL B with a Passenger Endorsement.


**Working Environment**  

General outdoor and office  

  

**Physical Demands**  

Some light lifting, prolonged periods of sitting in vehicle, standing, walking, bending, and stooping  

  

**Other Conditions:**  

**NOTE:** This position is safety sensitive. All candidates and employees must be able to successfully pass a pre-employment drug test with a negative result and are subject to additional testing as required by the DOT/FTA Drug and Alcohol regulations.
  

  

**This is a 24/7 operation employees in the title of Regional Supervisors** **work flexible schedules, including nights, weekends and holidays as NJ Transit operations dictate.** **Must be willing** **to respond to emergencies and work extra hours.**  

  

**At NJ Transit, you will enjoy a competitive salary and excellent benefits package:**
* Comprehensive Family Health Insurance – Medical, Prescription, Dental, Vision
* Flexible Spending Account
* Life Insurance
* Paid Leave
* Tuition Assistance
* Pre-Tax Commuter Benefits Plan
* Retirement Plans
	+ 401(a) - Retirement plan with a 6% employer contribution
	+ 401(k) - Retirement saving plan with up to an 3% company match
	+ 457(b) - Deferred Savings Plan

  

The DOT Drug and Alcohol Testing Regulation 49 CFR Part 40 **does not authorize** **the use of marijuana for any reason**. It is unacceptable for any safety-sensitive employee subject to drug testing under DOT regulations to use recreational or medical marijuana. The prohibitionincludes any derivative of marijuana such as CBD oils, teas, etc. T**he use of recreational and medical marijuana is a violation of NJ TRANSIT’s Drug and Alcohol-Free Workplace Policy** for safety-sensitive employees.  

**At NJ TRANSIT, diversity and inclusivity are vital to our success as we are committed to hiring individuals from diverse backgrounds, experiences, abilities, and veteran status. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we encourage all qualified applicants to apply and join our team.**

title: Principal Accountant - Revenue Accounting
description:
Move forward with us! At NJ TRANSIT, you'll join us in transforming the third-largest transportation agency in North America. We are committed to delivering safe, reliable service that gets customers to their destinations on time–and we're looking to hire talented folks with a commitment to excellence to make it all possible. **Summary:**
Assist in the compilation of data for the monthly financial closing process for Bus revenue sales received through Ticket Vending Machines, Ticket Office Machines, Park and Ride locations as well as from outside Commissioned Ticket Agents (CTA’s). Oversee the daily audit and reconciliation of paperwork from Bus Operations personnel (Bus Garages & Depot Masters). **Roles and Responsibilities:*** Compile, and prepare monthly journal entries to ensure timely and accurate reporting of Bus Revenue Data.
* Prepare General Ledger Account Reconciliations to ensure proper and accurate account activity in addition to,
* identifying and resolving reconciling items and accounting issues on a timely basis.
* Responsible for payments/reimbursements to/from third parties on a monthly basis for the value of tickets and passes sold by or made on behalf of NJ TRANSIT.

* Provide oversight and direction to Bus Revenue union staff in the performance of their daily tasks.
* Assists in the preparation of monthly line statistics which consists of accumulating revenue and ridership data for all NJ TRANSIT bus locations.

* Complete miscellaneous projects requested by Senior Management.

Five (5) years of applied accounting experience, preferably relation to Account Analysis, Reconciliations and familiar with General Ledger postings as well as receivables and payables.

title: Legal Secretary/Assistant
description:
The Legal Secretary is responsible for providing administrative support to attorneys by managing correspondence, scheduling, and document preparation. This role requires a strong understanding of legal terminology, procedures, and documentation.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Document Preparation:** Format and proofread legal documents such as briefs, pleadings, contracts, and legal correspondence. Ensure documents comply with legal procedures and formatting requirements.
* **Case Management:** Maintain and organize case files. Track case progress and deadlines, ensuring timely filing of documents.
* **Scheduling:** Coordinate and schedule meetings, hearings, depositions, and appointments. Manage attorneys' calendars.
* **Client Interaction:** Communicate with clients and other parties involved in legal matters. Handle inquiries, provide information, and relay messages accurately.
* **Filing and Record Keeping:** Maintain electronic filing system using Clio. Ensure all documents are filed correctly.
* **Administrative Support:** Maintain and monitor calendars, schedule mediations, meetings, and telephone conferences, and perform general office duties such as answering phones, and managing email correspondence.
* **Court Filings:** File legal documents with courts and regulatory agencies. Ensure adherence to court rules and deadlines.

**Skills and Qualifications:**

* **Experience:** Previous experience as a legal secretary or in a similar administrative role
* **Knowledge:** Familiarity with legal terminology, procedures, and document formatting. Proficiency in office software (e.g., Microsoft Office Suite)
* **Skills:** Excellent organizational, time management, and multitasking abilities. Strong attention to detail and accuracy. Effective written and verbal communication skills.
* **Discretion:** Ability to handle confidential and sensitive information with integrity and professionalism.
* **Multi-Tasking;** Ability to multitask and work in a fast paced environment.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $22.00 - $26.50 per hour

Work Location: In person

title: Risk Management Specialist
description:
Move forward with us! At NJ TRANSIT, you'll join us in transforming the third-largest transportation agency in North America. We are committed to delivering safe, reliable service that gets customers to their destinations on time–and we're looking to hire talented folks with a commitment to excellence to make it all possible.**Summary:**
Performs various tasks with the purpose of minimizing possible risks or losses for NJ Transit, as well as pursuing recoveries from third parties. **Roles and Responsibilities:*** Identifies claims or accidents involving damage to NJ TRANSIT property by a third party, investigates possible subrogation potential and obtains property damage estimates and other data in support of the subrogation/collection claim. Presents property damage claims to responsible parties’ insurance companies, businesses, and individuals for payment, and negotiates settlement of claims to conclusion. Obtains authorization from Director for compromise settlement, where required.
* Researches possible subrogation claims, analyzes defense and indemnification provisions of third-party contracts, and handles subrogation claims in accordance with NJ TRANSIT’s current contract with private bus/light rail operators or other responsible parties.
* Records, processes, and forwards subrogation claims on behalf of NJ TRANSIT to the New Jersey Attorney General’s Office, Debt Recovery Unit. Monitors status of litigated claims handled by New Jersey Attorney General’s Office, Debt Recovery Unit.
* Prepares reports, maintains files and records and prepares check requisitions for payment of insurance premiums and reimbursement of costs to third party bus/light rail operators.
* Maintains accurate information on subrogation/property damage claims in STARS Risk Management Information System or equivalent system.
* Effectively communicates and negotiates with insurance adjusters, attorneys, agents, claimants, and NJ TRANSIT employees in a timely and professional manner in furtherance of a full recovery of the costs of the property damage.
* Assists Director with administration of NJ TRANSIT’s railroad protective liability program; maintains accurate records of policies and assists in renewal of program.
* Assists Director with Risk Management and other special assignments as needed.

**Education, Experience, and Qualifications:*** Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration or related area or equivalent, and a five (5) or more years’ experience in Claims and/or Risk Management required.

**Knowledge and Skills:*** Excellent verbal, written, interpersonal, strong analytical and negotiation skills required. Must be a team player and possess strong computer skills with a knowledge of MS Office Products.

**At NJ Transit, you will enjoy a competitive salary and excellent benefits package:*** Comprehensive Family Health Insurance – Medical, Prescription, Dental, Vision
* Flexible Spending Account
* Life Insurance
* Paid Leave
* Tuition Assistance
* Pre-Tax Commuter Benefits Plan
* Retirement Plans
	+ 401(a) - Retirement plan with a 6% employer contribution
	+ 401(k) - Retirement saving plan with up to an 3% company match
	+ 457(b) - Deferred Savings Plan

**At NJ TRANSIT, diversity and inclusivity are vital to our success as we are committed to hiring individuals from diverse backgrounds, experiences, abilities, and veteran status. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we encourage all qualified applicants to apply and join our team.**
Learn more about NJ TRANSIT! Sign up to receive an invitation to our next live information session at WWW.NJTRANSIT.COM/BEST
company_description: Government-owned New Jersey Transit (NJ TRANSIT) provides bus, rail, and light rail passenger transportation services.

title: Assistant Signal Maintainer
description:
**Forbes List of America's Best Employers 2022, 2023, & 2024**
Move forward with us! At NJ TRANSIT, you'll join us in transforming the third-largest transportation agency in North America. We are committed to delivering safe, reliable service that gets our customers to their destinations on time—and we’re looking to hire talented folks with a love of learning to make it all possible.**Summary:**
The Assistant Signal Maintainer position is an entry-level position within the Engineering Department – Signal at New Jersey Transit Rail Operations. Signal Maintainers are responsible for the installation, testing, and maintenance of all equipment associated with railroad signaling (including but not limited to highway grade crossings, electrical/mechanical switches and railway traffic control signals). This position requires work to be performed outdoors, in all types of weather conditions, at various work locations throughout New Jersey TRANSIT’s network of 11 passenger rail lines.
Employees are subject to a (90) ninety-day probationary period. Upon and during successful completion of the probationary period, Assistant Signalmen will be enrolled into New Jersey TRANSIT’s Signal Training program and are contractually obligated to pass (8) company-sponsored training modules within a (2) two-year period in order to be promoted to the position of Signal Maintainer and maintain permanent employment with NJ TRANSIT.**Roles and Responsibilities:*** Assist fellow Signal Department employees in all manners of work involving the installation, testing, and maintenance of all forms of signal apparatus and functions.
* Excavate railroad right-of-ways for cable/conduit installations
* Cut tree limbs and brush overgrowth interfering with signal systems
* Climb stairwells and ladders (with fall prevention equipment) to perform work.
* Walk over and working on top on fixed overhead fixed and movable railroad bridges.
* Clean and paint exterior/interior signal equipment housing.
* Transport employees, supplies, and equipment to various locations throughout New Jersey with company vehicles.
* Comply with all safety policies, practices, and procedures following routine and all standards of performance. Maintain a safe working environment.

**Education, Experience, and Qualifications:*** Be able to pass NJ TRANSIT’s Signal Maintainer Aptitude Test
* Have basic knowledge of electricity: series and parallel circuits, Ohm’s Law, resistance, etc.
* Have basic knowledge of electronics: diodes, capacitors, rectifiers, circuit boards, etc.
* Possess the ability to be able to learn and use various types of electrical measuring instruments.
* Successfully pass background, drug screening, and physical
* Be able to work various shifts, holidays, and weekends
* Have a Valid Driver’s License
* Have a High School Diploma or GED

**Physical Demands:*** Perform various types of physical labor duties like digging, lifting, and climbing
* Possess a physical ability to use various types of hand and power tools
* Be exposed to equipment that intensifies the heat factor on an occasional basis
* Wear protective equipment such as hardhat, safety glasses, and safety-toe boots
* Perform heavy lifting and carrying tasks with the weight of up to (50) fifty pounds
* Apply pushing and pulling force of (60) sixty pounds pressure during manual cranking operation of railroad switches
* Work outdoors in all types of weather conditions, including in confined spaces and at various

**At NJ TRANSIT, diversity and inclusivity are vital to our success as we are committed to hiring individuals from diverse backgrounds, experiences, abilities, and veteran status. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we encourage all qualified applicants to apply and join our team.**
Learn more about NJ TRANSIT! Sign up to receive an invitation to our next live information session at WWW.NJTRANSIT.COM/BEST

title: Architectural CAD Drafter
description:
**Job Title:** Architectural Drawing Coordinator

**Job Summary:**

The Architectural Drawing Coordinator plays a critical role in ensuring the efficiency and accuracy of drafting processes within CMR. This position involves allocating drafting workloads, establishing and documenting CMR’s drawing standards, and ensuring these standards are consistently applied across all projects. The coordinator collaborates closely with the rendering team, conducts site visits, and organizes project files for streamlined access and efficiency. Additionally, the role includes researching and integrating new technologies for both drafting and rendering, providing training, and serving as the go-to expert for troubleshooting challenging projects. The coordinator also draws the most complex components when required and collaborates with builders to ensure accurate implementation of designs.

**Key Responsibilities:**

· Assign drafting workloads and make adjustments as needed to ensure optimal productivity.

· Establish and document CMR Drawing Standards, ensuring they are comprehensive up to date and followed by all.

· Provide training on CMR Drawing Standards and related applications to ensure proper use for all projects.

· Review drawings for accuracy, ensuring they meet both internal and industry standards as well as building codes.

· Research and integrate new technologies to enhance drafting processes and outcomes.

· Troubleshoot challenging projects, offering solutions and guidance to the drafting team.

· Coordinate with builders and architects as necessary to ensure drawings are understood and correctly coordinated and implemented.

· Conduct site visits as needed to gather measurements and verify existing conditions.

· Draw the most complex components on request, providing expert-level input where needed.

· Organize and maintain project files to streamline access and enhance efficiency.

**Qualifications:**

· Associate's degree in Drafting, Interior Design, or a related field.

· 5 years of experience in Interior Design Drafting

· High proficiency in CAD software (AutoCAD, SketchUp, etc.).

· Strong understanding of interior design principles and construction methods.

· Experience in establishing and maintaining drawing standards.

· Exceptional attention to detail and precision in reviewing technical drawings.

· Strong communication, leadership, and teamwork skills.

· Ability to manage multiple projects, train team members, and meet tight deadlines.

**Preferred Qualifications:**

· Bachelor's degree in Interior Design or a related field.

· Experience with BIM (Building Information Modeling) technology.

· Familiarity with sustainable design practices.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $50.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Experience:

* Drafting: 5 years (Required)

Ability to Commute:

* Lakewood, NJ 08701 (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: School Receptionist Leave Replacement
description:
**Position Title:** School Receptionist Leave Replacement 10/21/24 to 4/14/25)

Compensation: $41,000 (prorated based on assignment dates)

Please visit iLearnSchools.org/careers to apply online and learn more details

Candidate must have experience with ATS (Automate the School) Automate the Schools in a computerized Student Information System that standardizes and automates the collection and reporting of data for all students in public schools (both district and charter) in New York City.

**Summary:**

As a member of the charter school office team, the school secretary will manage and assist with responsibilities needed to efficiently manage the school office. This position requires a high degree of responsibility, discretion, independent judgment and confidentiality.

**Qualifications:**

* High school diploma or its equivalent required. Post-secondary education is preferred.
* Secretarial training preferred.
* Minimum of one year of school office experience preferred.
* Demonstrate proficiency in the use of Microsoft Office and office related mathematical skills.
* Working knowledge of the Google database preferred.
* Strong analytical, reasoning and human relations skills.
* Demonstrate the ability to effectively communicate orally and in writing, using proper grammar and vocabulary.
* Possessing the skills to read, write and communicate in Spanish is preferred.
* Understand the requirement to maintain confidentiality concerning charter school related matters.
* **Prior to employment, the following must be addressed:**
* Required to complete a criminal history background check to prove that the individual has not been convicted of a crime or a disorderly person’s offense.
* Provide evidence that health is adequate to fulfill the job functions and responsibilities with reasonable accommodation.
* Provide evidence Tdap (Tetanus-diphtheria-acellular pertussis) Rubella, Measles, Mumps, Tuberculosis/PPD Test and Varicella
* Possessing a valid driver’s license is preferred.
* Meet such alternatives to the above qualifications as the school director finds appropriate and acceptable.

**Requirements/Environmental Conditions:**

The physical demands and work environment factors described below are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

* Requires prolonged sitting
* Occasionally requires physical exertion to manually move, lift, carry, pull, or push objects or materials.
* Requires the ability to work in noisy and crowded environments.
* Occasionally requires standing, stooping, bending, or reaching.

**Performance Responsibilities:**

The school secretary shall :

* Pursue the vision and execute the mission of iLearn Schools Inc.
* Serve as a contributing member of the charter school’s office team.
* Support and promote board and administrative initiatives and decisions.
* Possess an understanding of the charter school renewal process and assist with the process as needed.
* Display the highest ethical and professional behavior in working with students, parents, school personnel and outside agencies associated with the charter school.
* Maintain professional competence and continuous improvement through professional growth.
* Foster and maintain communication and dialogue with the staff, parents, students and the general public.
* Participate in appropriate service and workshop programs and attend any required meetings.
* Protect confidentiality of records and information about staff or students and use discretion when sharing such information within legal confines.
* Adhere to federal statutes and regulations, school law, State Department of Education rules and regulations, iLearn Schools policies, procedures and contractual obligations.
* Take immediate action and notify appropriate personnel concerning any evidence of substance abuse, child abuse, child neglect, severe medical or social conditions, potential suicide or individuals appearing to be under the influence of alcohol, controlled substances, or anabolic steroids.
* Follow school affirmative action procedures.
* Organize and maintain an efficient and effective school office which includes performing confidential school related tasks and maintaining a thorough knowledge and understanding of the charter school rules and regulations.
* Communicate the charter school rules and regulations to students, parents and the community.
* Formulate, reproduce and distribute notices and school bulletins to staff, students and parents.
* Professionally greet and communicate with staff, students, parents and school visitors. When interacting with the school community, practice proper phone etiquette and professional discretion.
* Issue electronic/paper communications that are written with appropriate language, phrases and punctuation. Use of slang or text language is not acceptable.
* Work cooperatively with school administration to develop and maintain the school calendar of activities and arrange/confirm school appointments for administration and staff.
* Assist school administration with the organization of the after school club program. In addition, be responsible for the collection of club fees.
* Oversee new student registration while acting as the first point of contact for parents. During admission, the secretary oversees the entire process including communication with the sending district, accuracy of registration information and keeping track of required information.
* Prepare student attendance records and reports maintaining the accuracy of all required documents. In addition, monitor student attendance and in potential student truancy cases, alert the school director and the required central office personnel.
* Maintain an efficient and well organized electronic and paper data collection and filing system.
* Collect and organize the monies received for school sponsored activities and provide the necessary documentation as required by school auditors.
* Assist school administration and teaching staff members with the accuracy of maintaining book inventories and the ordering of school equipment and supplies.
* Issue announcements and operate the school telephone intercom system.
* Provide ongoing communication with transportation companies concerning early student dismissal, delayed opening or changes in the school calendar.
* Assist the administration and faculty with the preparation of reports and documents. In formulating school reports or documents, create a finished product that is accurate and well designed.
* Assist in the collection of data for local, county, state or federal reports.
* Possess an understanding of the campus safety and security manual.
* Provide clerical and office support to the school administrative team.
* Assist the school safety team with notification to appropriate personnel concerning school evacuation, fire or safety drills.
* Manage various school functions and events as assigned.
* Assist in the collection of student lunch accounts and/or account balances. Within this responsibility is the ongoing communication with parents to keep the student lunch accounts current and accurate.
* Attend school sponsored events as requested.
* Demonstrate a supportive role in the school fundraising projects.
* Perform any other duties within the scope of his/her employment and certification that may be assigned.

**Reports to:** School Director

**Supervises:** Assist with the supervision of the school receptionist

**Terms of Employment:** Temporary

Job Types: Full-time, Temporary, Contract

Pay: $41,000.00 per year

title: Analyst, Programmatic
description:
**Company Description**  

 PubW is a bespoke business unit set up to bring the full power of the Publicis Groupe together to support Walmart’s media and data needs. Through our Power of One model, we put Walmart at the center bringing together specialists in strategy, media investment, data, influencers, commerce, and content delivering a highly connected, purpose-led and collaborative approach for our clients. PubW’s mission is to help Walmart navigate a period of intense change, continually keeping them “one more step ahead”. This means challenging conventions, driving continual progress, and pushing the marketplace to keep Walmart at the forefront of the media industry. Our approach is grounded in using data and technology to connect with real people across the full funnel, ensuring that Walmart’s investment in media is directly contributing to innovative marketing experiences, driving brand and business growth.

 **Job Description** **Overview:**


The Programmatic Analyst is responsible for campaign management activities such as campaign set-up, documentation creation and maintenance, QA, performance reporting and billing reconciliation. The Programmatic Analyst is responsible for identifying and implementing optimizations as approved by the Senior Programmatic Analyst and client, providing input in the construction of client decks and status documentation.


The ideal candidate will have some prior online trafficking experience and basic experience with Doubleclick DART or similar campaign management systems. Prior experience with bid management platforms and active campaign optimization efforts is a plus.


Most importantly, the Programmatic Analyst must possess a strong inner drive to redesign the digital media landscape, enjoy working with some of the finest minds in the industry, and truly be a part of something unique that will have a lasting impact on Publicis’ network of agencies.

**Role Objectives:**

* Execute, manage, and optimize online media campaigns and programs for agency clients (e.g. auction/exchange-based performance media, audience-based buying, remarketing campaigns) both independently and in support of Campaign Managers
* Demonstrate diligence, attention to detail, and adherence to programmatic best practices throughout the full programmatic campaign life-cycle
* Maintain and organize campaign-specific materials in team’s shared document repository
* Handle daily campaign maintenance, including internal questions regarding tracking and status of various campaigns
* Assist in the development of client-facing campaign performance reports
* Contribute to the assessment of inventory availability and the formulation of proposals for new client opportunities
* Manage the delivery of creative assets, insertion orders, campaign artifacts, and all relevant campaign documentation in preparation for campaign launch
* Traffic campaign tags into ad exchange environments
* Run the campaign QA process to ensure accurate campaign implementation, pacing, and performance
* Provide monthly auditing reports to Agency partners & actualize bill/pay systems when applicable
* Participate in regular knowledge sharing sessions to share and learn new strategies for optimizing and enhancing

  

**Qualifications** **Minimum Qualifications:**

* 1+ year of Programmatic media experience
* Relevant professional or Internship experience, preferably in bid management, campaign management, or digital operations
* Understanding of traditional and interactive media planning elements
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office solutions
* Strong analytical thinking and mathematical skills
* Excellent communication and writing skills
* Ability to organize and manage detail work campaign performance

 **Additional Information** *Compensation Range: $ 46,500 - $ 70,000 annually. This is the pay range the Company believes it will pay for this position at the time of this posting. Consistent with applicable law, compensation will be determined based on the skills, qualifications, and experience of the applicant along with the requirements of the position, and the Company reserves the right to modify this pay range at any time. For this role, the Company will offer medical coverage, dental, vision, disability, 401k, and paid time off. The Company anticipates the application deadline for this job posting will be 08/27/2024.*


All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

description:
Job Summary:

We are seeking a reliable and experienced Forklift Operator to join our team. The successful candidate will be responsible for the safe and efficient operation of forklifts and other heavy equipment in our warehouse and shipping receiving areas. This is an essential role that requires attention to detail, physical stamina, and a commitment to safety and quality control.

Responsibilities:

- Operate forklifts and other heavy equipment such as reach trucks and cherry pickers to move and store packages and materials throughout the warehouse and shipping receiving areas.  
- Conduct order picking and fulfillment duties, ensuring that all items are accurately and efficiently located and delivered to the correct areas.  
- Perform quality control checks on packages and materials to ensure that they meet the required standards.  
- Follow all safety guidelines and protocols to prevent accidents and injuries.  
- Maintain the cleanliness and organization of the warehouse and shipping receiving areas.  
- Work closely with the warehouse supervisor to ensure that all tasks are completed to the highest standard and that the warehouse runs smoothly and efficiently.  
- Operate a package handler to move and store packages and materials throughout the warehouse and shipping receiving areas.  
- Assist with shipping and receiving duties, including the loading and unloading of packages and materials.

Requirements:

- Proven experience in operating forklifts and other heavy equipment.  
- Knowledge of warehouse operations and the ability to work in a fast-paced environment.  
- Strong attention to detail and a commitment to quality control.  
- Ability to lift and carry heavy packages and materials.  
- Experience in order fulfillment and order picking is preferred.  
- Ability to work at heights using cherry pickers and other aerial equipment.  
- Knowledge of heavy equipment operation and maintenance is an asset.  
- Ability to work in a team environment and follow instructions from the warehouse supervisor.  
- Strong communication and organizational skills.  
- Ability to maintain a clean and organized workspace.  
- Must be physically fit and able to lift and carry heavy packages and materials.

title: Registered Nurse Case Manager
description:
We are seeking a dedicated and compassionate Registered Nurse (RN) Case Manager to join our dynamic healthcare team. This position plays a vital role in providing high-quality and compassionate healthcare services to clients and their families. The RN Case Manager will be responsible for conducting initial assessments, developing individualized care plans, and ensuring that clients receive the best possible care through regular home visits and collaboration with the interdisciplinary team.

**Responsibilities:**

* Conduct initial assessments of new clients to determine their healthcare needs and develop individualized care plans.
* Perform regular home visits to assess client progress and make necessary adjustments to care plans.
* Collaborate with the interdisciplinary team to ensure proper patient care.
* Provide education and emotional support to clients and their families.
* Maintain accurate and up-to-date patient records and documentation.
* Provide in-service training and guidance to Home Health Aides and Personal Care Assistants to ensure the highest quality of care delivery.
* Participate in team meetings and contribute to the development of care strategies.

title: Full-time Front of House Associate
description:
**Company Overview:** Do you want to be on the forefront of regenerative medicine, medical aesthetics, and hormone therapy? Empire Portfolio Group, the company that helped Orangetheory Fitness become the fastest growing fitness franchise in the world, is now setting its sights on personalized health, wellness and anti-aging. Empire, in partnership with Relive Health, will be launching dozens of medical wellness centers around the country and we're looking for top talent who are fanatical about transforming people's lives.

**Job Overview:** 

The Front of House Associate will be the first point of contact that our clients interact with. You will represent the energy and atmosphere of the wellness center. Your ability to communicate will be essential by listening to clients’ needs and sharing your extensive knowledge of the Relive products and services. You will create lasting relationships with clients, staff and vendors.

**Responsibilities**:

* Welcome clients on arrival and notify treatment provider to ensure appointments are taken in a timely manner and efficiently schedule client appointments based on providers’ and treatment room availability. Anticipate client’s needs by answering questions or concerns proactively vs reactively.
* Maintain cleanliness of reception area
* Maintains client accounts by obtaining, recording, and updating personal and financial information.
* Help achieve business and performance goals for the center.
* Maintain, and protect clients’ rights by abiding by HIPPA regulations and maintaining confidentiality of personal and financial information.
* Maintains operations by following policies and procedures; reporting needed changes.
* Liaise with admin and other medical team members pre and post therapy and participate in shared decision making.
* Accurately use the online booking systems.
* The duties and responsibilities described are not a comprehensive list and additional tasks may be assigned to the employee

**Requirements/Skills:**

* High School diploma or equivalent is required. Bachelor's degree preferred
* **1-2 years' experience working in a Medspa facility or wellness center is required**
* Must have excellent communication and listening skills.
* Must have excellent computer skills.
* Scheduling appointments and working with an appointment tracking system is highly preferred.
* Excellent computer skills required
* Multi -tasking, Time Management, Organization, Attention to Detail, Professionalism, Quality Focus. Ability to work well under pressure with minimal supervision. Proven flexibility and willingness to handle a variety of tasks.
* Knowledge of modern office procedures.
* Good communicator, with developed verbal and written communication skills in English.
* Be able to demonstrate the ability to establish effective working relationships with other staff as well as with external suppliers.

**Work Environment:**

* Potential exposure to hazardous materials and bloodborne pathogens. OSHA Training will be provided
* This position requires standing, walking, bending, and kneeling daily. The employee must have the ability to move quickly to respond to client needs.

**Compensation:**

* $20 per hour

**Beyond the Paycheck:**

* Complimentary services and employee discounts with Orangetheory Fitness and Relive Health
* Empire cares about you—we offer access to free mental health counseling
* Discounts on theme parks, travel, movies, etc. through LifeMart and TicketsAtWork
* Pre-tax commuter benefit plan to save on public transportation to/from work
* Employee discounts
* Professional development assistance

**Schedule:** Monday to Friday and every other weekend

**Work location:**  On-site.

**About Empire:** Empire Portfolio Group™ was founded in 2013 with a vision to develop strong brands and supercharge their long-term growth. In an increasingly crowded and competitive industry, our team not only outperforms the norm but most importantly prioritizes making differences in team and studio members' lives. Headquartered in New York City, Empire Portfolio Group is a leading Area Representative and franchisee of Orangetheory Fitness. The Company owns, operates and supports 140+ Orangetheory Fitness studios across DC, Connecticut, Maine, New Hampshire, New Jersey, New York, North Carolina, South Carolina, Vermont, and Virginia. Empire is also launching Relive Health which provides anti-aging and wellness services which include hormone optimization, medical aesthetics, vitamin therapy, and regenerative medicine. Empire plans to open hundreds of locations across a dozen states in the next few years. The mission of Relive Health is to help people take control of their "healthspan" (the length of time that a person stays healthy) through personalized wellness products and services.

**Our Mission:** To bring out your best life through inspiring, motivating and exceptional moments **Vision:** To be the premier wellness portfolio that supercharges everyday life **Values:** Happy, Hungry, Humble, Healthy & Human

**EEO Statement:** 

Empire Portfolio Group is an equal opportunity employer and will not discriminate against any applicant or employee on the basis of age, race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, ancestry, marital status or other classification prohibited by applicable local, state or federal laws. This policy is applicable to hiring, termination, compensation, schedules, discipline, working conditions and all other aspects of employment. As an employee, you are expected to honor this policy and to take an active role in keeping harassment and discrimination out of the workplace. We are happy to work with otherwise qualified disabled employees in order to accommodate limitations, in accordance with the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA). It is up to the employee to approach the office manager with this request and provide medical proof of his or her needs upon at the Company’s request.

title: Installation Supervisor
description:
**Position: Installation Supervisor**

**Location: Astoria, NY/ Corona, New Mexico**

**Length: 12+months**

* HVDC converter / switching stations, onshore and / or offshore.
* Transformers converter and / or AC.
* HV cable, pulling and termination.
* LV control & power cables, pulling and termination.
* HV Main circuit equipment including breakers, reactors, resistors, arresters, CTs, etc.
* AC GIS and / or AIS installations.

**JOB Description**  
The Installation Supervisor organizes, and coordinates Client activities related to installation work and test of the equipment on site, within the field of responsibility related to installation. The Installation Supervisor is a project site-based role, and they report directly to the Global Manager of HVDC Installation. They are involved on all aspects of the installation scope including HSE, quality control, programme, and execution. Reporting to the Installation Manager at the site level, the Installation Supervisor will typically act as the Installation Managers second. Processes for these responsibilities can be found within the Adonis online system. The responsibility to complete these tasks falls onto the Installation Manager, however it will be the role of the Installation Supervisor to assist in the completion of these tasks, in a more visible presence on site. This document provides the minimum expected from an Installation Supervisor working on a Client site, however the below list is non exhaustive. When this description states “ensures”, the responsibility sits with another function, but the Installation Supervisor should check that this work is being done.

**Main Responsibilities and Accountabilities:**

Reports and gives assistance to the following based on the installation scope:

· Site Manager– Any communication with the Site Manager is done via the Installation Manager following to correct lines of communication. In the absence of the Installation Manager, the Installation Supervisor will provide planning information and coordination over all activities. Ensures that the Site Manager is given all the necessary information to report back within the project.

· Installation Manager – At site level, an Installation Supervisor reports directly to the Installation Manager and receives their daily tasks from the Installation Manager.

· Civil Construction Representative – Co-ordinates the installation work with the civil team.

· HSE Team – Aids the HSE team with all matters relating to the installation scope. This can include the control of work areas, review of RAMS documentation and general co-ordination.

· Quality Team – Raises quality concerns and provides information relating to all installation scope QITs. Commissioning Team - Co-ordinates the installation work with the commissioning scope whenever there is an overlap. Takes a key role in assessing work areas for electrical safety when there is an overlap between

· installation and commissioning scopes.

· Document Control – Ensures that the installation contractor is using the correct “issued for construction” drawings and that they are the correct revision.

· Logistics Coordinator– Works closely with the Logistics Coordinator to ensure that all equipment is available in the work area on time and stored as per the correct requirements.

· Rest of the Site Installation Team – This could include another Installation Supervisor, Installation Manager, Cable Supervisor, Valve Supervisor, Transformer Supervisor, however this list is not exhaustive. The Installation Supervisor should work as a team within this function and support each other’s roles. For example, covering where needing and sharing any observations that may assist other members of the team.

· Installation Contractor – Co-ordinates all the installation work with the installation contractor and ensures that they have all the necessary information required to complete this scope of work.

**Other Responsibilities:**

· They will ensure that the works are completed in a safe manner and are all in compliance with the relevant safety and environmental plans on site.

· Ensure the works are regularly coordinated with all other parties on site.

· Takes part and assist the HSE department in the review and implementation of the RAMS.

· Continually review the RAMS in line with the status of the works and ensures the works are completed in compliance with the RAMS.

· Ensure all plant and equipment used for the installation scope is in good working order, operated by experienced personnel and supplied with valid certification.

· Ensure that personnel on site are wearing the correct PPE and it is in good condition.

· Ensure that a pre-work brief is completed before the start of each task which includes the briefing of the RAMS to the working party, point of work risk assessment and any other relevant documentation.

· Report hazards, near misses, safety observations, good practices to the onsite HSE team.

· Assist the HSE team in any incident investigations should the need arise.

· Ensure that good housekeeping practices are maintained in all installation work areas. Ensure that all waste management is followed, and correct waste streams are used

· Makes sure that all changes are identified and communicated to the relevant parties.

· Assures that Client commitments to the customer are met in accordance with the contract and any country specific requirements.

· Assists in technical discussions with the customer and the customers consultants.

· Attends weekly progress meetings with the contractor.

· Quality checks during the installation including ITR inspections and checking compliance with the ITP.

· Ensuring the contractor completes its works using safe work practices.

· Ensuring that the contractor completes its works in accordance with the contract programme.

· Guides the installation contractor throughout the installation and gives assistance wherever required.

· Ensures the installation is built correctly in accordance with the latest issued construction drawings.

· Ensures that all works and testing is done using in date calibrated tools and equipment.

· Offers technical assistance on correct installation methods and queries.

· Keeps the documentations in order and ensures that the latest revision is used for the installation works.

· Continuously updates working documents and ensures that the “Site Master” are updated with Red Marks throughout the installation period. Red marks can be either hard copies within the site master binders, or

· electronically handled within BIM360 or other digital tools.

· Support in engineering DRMs, to review and provide feedback from a site point of view making sure the erection perspective and safe method of working is considered in the design.

· Uses the QIT online application for reporting all deviations and improvements and follows these up.

· Ensures that the Site Quality Plan is followed.

· Joins the Installation Manager and customer for regular quality walks around the completed installation.

· Assists when it comes to ITR inspections with the installation contractor and customer. The completion of the ITRs is the responsibility of the installation contractor, however the Installation Supervisor should assist

· to ensure that the ITR inspections are being done correctly.

· Ensures that the equipment is stored correctly, and any preservation requirements are completed. When applicated, assists on any mechanical completion inspections with the customer.

· Assists the Installation Manager when it comes to any area handover inspections.

· At the end of the project, assists with the collation and documentation of all the lessons learnt information.

· Assists with the planning of site activities, including resources with the sub-contractor, milestones and follows-up the site activities, according to the plan for each area of responsibility.

· Aids the installation contractor with the correct planning of their works and when applicable, for less experienced contractors helps mentor them through the process.

· Understands the critical path scheduling.

· Aids in the production of a strategy to reduce the risks around the critical path.

· Regularly reports site progress, hindrances, state of material supply etc. to the rest of the team.

· Actively looks for optimizations in the overall project plan and implements where possible.In case of delays, helps finds the best strategy to mitigate these delays.

· Ensures correct handling, storage & installation of equipment according to manufactures instructions.

· Assists in the receiving and inspection log inspections that are completed for all equipment deliveries. This is the responsibility of the Logistics Coordinator, however the Installation Supervisor should offer some

· technical assistance during these inspections, when required.

· Regularly liaises with the Logistics Coordinator to ensure equipment is available at the correct time ready for the programmed installation works.

· Monitor equipment laydown areas for correct storage and preservation requirements.

Job Type: Contract

Pay: $50.00 - $55.00 per hour

Experience:

* Installation or install\\* or "installation supervisor": 5 years (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
**Job Summary:**

The Administrative Assistant provides comprehensive administrative support to ensure smooth and efficient operations within a specific area or department. This role involves handling a variety of tasks, including coordinating schedules, managing communications, organizing documents, and assisting with day-to-day administrative functions. The ideal candidate will be detail-oriented, possess strong organizational skills, and have the ability to multitask effectively in a fast-paced environment.

**Responsibilities:**

* Schedule Management: Coordinate meetings, appointments, and events for the operating area or department, ensuring optimal use of time and resources.
* Communication Management: Serve as a primary point of contact for internal and external communications, including phone calls, emails, and correspondence.
* Document Management: Organize and maintain documents, records, and files, both in physical and electronic formats, ensuring accuracy and accessibility.
* Data Entry: Input and update data into relevant databases, spreadsheets, and systems with a high level of accuracy and attention to detail.
* Administrative Support: Assist with various administrative tasks, such as preparing reports, presentations, and agendas, as well as handling expense reports and managing office supplies.
* Coordination: Collaborate with other team members and departments to facilitate seamless operations and information flow.
* Record Keeping: Maintain accurate records of meetings, decisions, and actions, and ensure timely follow-up on outstanding tasks.
* Research: Conduct research as needed to support projects, initiatives, or decision-making processes within the operating area.
* Confidentiality: Handle sensitive information with discretion and maintain confidentiality in all aspects of the role.
* Problem Solving: Identify and resolve administrative issues and challenges in a proactive and timely manner.

**Qualifications:**

* High school diploma or equivalent; associate’s or bachelor’s degree preferred.
* Proven experience in an administrative support role, preferably in a similar industry or environment.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook) and other relevant software applications.
* Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
* Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.
* Ability to prioritize tasks and manage time effectively.
* Adaptability and willingness to learn new skills and processes.
* Discretion and professionalism when handling confidential information.
* Ability to work independently as well as part of a team.
* Flexibility to adapt to changing priorities and deadlines.

This job description is intended to convey information essential to understanding the scope of the position and is not exhaustive. Duties and responsibilities may be subject to change based on organizational needs.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $20.00 - $23.00 per hour

* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Day shift
* Monday to Friday

Experience:

* Microsoft Excel: 1 year (Preferred)
* Microsoft Powerpoint: 1 year (Preferred)

Ability to Commute:

* Brooklyn, NY (Required)

title: Customer Service Specialist II
description:
The Customer Service Specialist II works to support the Director of Customer Service, with the goal of providing information, documentation, and exemplary customer service to callers.

**Essential Duties and Responsibilities**:  

Utilizes Electronic Health Record system to review caller information.  

Ensures all caller requests are logged and responded to in an expeditious manner.  

Performs outreach to providers, either randomly or targeted, via phone to assess level of satisfaction and to provide support.  

Performs QA functions on call center related documentation to ensure consistency in reporting.  

Assists the Director of Customer Service by tracking and gathering data points that would help to consistently improve the level of communication and service.  

Assists the Customer Service Center when required by responding to caller inquiries via phone and email.  

Maintains record of all interactions utilizing the CRM system.  

Provides support and assistance to Customer Service Specialists on call center procedures as requested by the Director of Customer Service.  

Responds to any emergency situations that may occur during a call, including contacting 911 if necessary to ensure the safety of the caller.  

Reports any allegations of abuse or neglect as reported via the Customer Service Center by members or providers.  

Adheres to all company policies and procedures.  

Performs other duties as assigned.  

Maintains confidentiality. Must possess a valid Drivers License from New York, or a contiguous state (i.e., Connecticut, New Jersey, Pennsylvania, and Vermont) OR must have the ability to take ample public transportation to attend meetings in person in the community and in the office as needed.

**Education and Experience**:  

A High School diploma and at least two years of prior call center or customer service experience is required.  

A Bachelors degree and at least one year of experience working in a call center is preferred.  

Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite including Word, Excel, PowerPoint is required.  

Experience working with people and families of people with I/DD preferred but not required.  

Strong phone and verbal communication skills along with active listening.  

Customer focus and adaptability to different personality types.  

Ability to multi-task, set priorities and solve issues effectively.  

Demonstrate professionalism, respect, and ability to work in a team.  

Must possess strong customer service skills.

title: Producer, Experiential Production
description:
**Company Description** **About Dentsu Creative**


Dentsu Creative US is comprised of audacious thinkers and award-winning collaborators across the United States who blend local knowledge with global expertise.


Choose substance over stunts, our Modern Creative mandate is about unlocking sustained growth and holistic impact for brands in ways that Create Culture, Change Society and Invent the Future. We do it daily for notable brands.


Our borderless approach allows us to assemble passionate team members around each brief, tapping into the expertise of the 9,000+ people in dentsu international's global creative network. This integrated model also allows our talent to learn about and explore the scope of career possibilities within Dentsu Creative.


Job Location: Remote (Preference for candidates in the NJ, NY or PA markets)

 **Job Description** **Role Purpose**


Reporting to the Director, Experiential Production, you will oversee event planning and activation, and lead on-site production in Massachusetts and Rhode Island, ensuring all deliverables are met.

* You will coordinate staffing and logistics for all non-premise brand experiences (event staffing, asset transportation, product delivery).
* You will manage local storage and inventory of event assets, POS and general event supplies.
* You will work with vendors, including insurance carriers, procure permits, civic documents, and permits.
* You will be responsible for post event recaps, feedback, goal event data recaps and insights on all events.
* You will oversee client communication, challenges, and solutions.
* You will manage our PO system, event budget creation and implementation, expense tracking and management, and reporting.
* You will ensure activation in compliance with state event regulations, local sampling laws, company policies, and client marketing codes.

  

**Qualifications** **Person Specification**

* 2 years of experience producing experiential/event production projects within a marketing or communications environment in the spirits/beer/wine industry
* Familiar with the Phoenix, AZ market and are flexible to accommodate work travel to the area
* Organizational and coordinating abilities
* Managed numerous events and timelines simultaneously
* Prepare agreements for all events
* Comfortable working high-volume events

  

**Additional Information**  

* **Additional Information:** The anticipated salary range for this position is $59,000 - $96,025. Actual salary will be based on a variety of factors including relevant experience, knowledge, skills and other factors permitted by law. A range of medical, dental, vision, 401(k) matching, paid time off, or other benefits also are available. For more information about dentsu benefits, please visit dentsubenefitsplus.com.


#LI-Remote #LI-BB1

**About dentsu**  

Dentsu is an integrated growth and transformation partner to the world’s leading organizations. Founded in 1901 in Tokyo, Japan, and now present in more than 110 markets, it has a proven track record of nurturing and developing innovations, combining the talents of its global network of leadership brands to develop impactful and integrated growth solutions for clients. Dentsu delivers end-to-end experience transformation (EX) by integrating its services across Media, CXM and Creative, while its business transformation (BX) mindset pushes the boundaries of transformation and sustainable growth for brands, people and society.


Dentsu, Innovating to Impact.


Find out more:  

https://www.dentsu.com/  

https://www.group.dentsu.com/en/


We are champions for meaningful progress and we strive to be a force for good—for our people, for our clients, for the industry and for our society. We keep our people at the center, creating space for growth, understanding and learning so they can thrive. We embed diversity, in our mindset, in our solutions and in our teams to empower an inclusive, equitable and culturally fluent environment. Building this culture within our teams makes us better collaborators with each other and with our clients, driving better outcomes for all.


Dentsu (the "Company") is committed to a policy of Equal Employment Opportunity and will not discriminate against an applicant or employee of the Company, on the basis of age, sex, sexual orientation, race, color, creed, religion, ethnicity, national origin, alienage or citizenship, disability, marital status, veteran or military status, genetic information, or any other legally-recognized protected basis under federal, state or local laws, regulations or ordinances. Applicants with disabilities may be entitled to reasonable accommodation under the terms of the Americans with Disabilities Act and/or certain state or local laws. A reasonable accommodation is a change in the way things are normally done that will ensure an equal employment opportunity without imposing an undue hardship on the Company. Please contact your recruiter if you need assistance completing any forms or to otherwise participate in the application process or to request or discuss an accommodation in connection with a job at the Company to which you are applying.

* Ability to drive a vehicle over 50% of the shift.
* Ability to work in a safe manner when lifting and performing tasks associated with position.
* Experience in trouble shooting or electro mechanical work.
* Ability to follow the expectations set forth in the Field Service Handbook.
* Excellent communication skills, written/verbal with internal and external contacts.
* Proven ability to be organized, detailed, multi-tasker, critical thinker, accurate, thorough and a problem-solver.
* Ability to adapt to change in the workplace or assignment of duties.

 **PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:**  

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by Team Members to successfully perform the essential functions of the field technician position.  

  

*Communication:*  

While performing the duties of this job, the Team Member is regularly required to communicate with customers in the field, and fellow Team Members, which requires the ability to speak and hear. Required to complete reports which requires ability to write and/or type.
  

  

*Physical Demands:*

**O (Occasionally)** Position requires this activity up to 33% of the time (0 2.5+ hours/day)  

**F (Frequently)** Position requires this activity from 33% - 66% of the time (2.5 5.5+ hrs/day)  

**C (Constantly)** Position requires this activity more than 66% of the time (5.5+ hrs/day)

 **WORK ENVIRONMENT:**  

This job operates in a traveling capacity within a van (and sometimes more depending on assigned route) and will be exposed to weather conditions within the specific territory. This job also involves operation at customer locations (estimated 50% of shift). Team Member will receive direction via phone or email. This role routinely requires the use of lifting equipment, hand tools, iPad and cell phone, etc.  

  

This is a full-time position. Work schedule is flexible, includes nights, weekends, holidays and on call duty.
  

  

**OTHER DUTIES:**

title: Phillips Market Training Expert
description:
Are you a coffee enthusiast and have a passion for communicating with others? We are looking for a self-motivated, energetic individual to join our exciting field team as a Market Training Expert representing Phillips Domestic Appliances, a leader in small appliances. Our ideal candidate is passionate about the Philips brand and their extensive line of coffee & espresso products. You will bring genuine excitement for the brand into various retail locations. You will conduct consistent visits to share the benefits and features of the products with store associates by providing training in both a 1-on-1 and group setting. Find your inspiration with Philips!

This is a part-time role working up to 10 hours per week with the flexibility to control your schedule during retail hours, Monday-Friday. This role requires regular in-market travel for store visits (up to a 60-mile radius).

Take a look at our video showcasing Why You Belong at BDS! Apply today and embark on a new career journey!

**WHAT WE OFFER**

* Competitive weekly pay with bonus potential
* Early wage access – get paid when you need it
* 401(k) with employer match
* Paid training
* Paid mileage and drive-time
* Employee assistance plan
* Paid sick time
* Referral bonus opportunities
* Opportunity to work with a growing company that actively rewards and promotes its employees

**WHAT YOU’LL DO**

* Build brand loyalty and creditability with in-store retail sales associates
* Travel within an assigned market to visit all stores in the territory according to the designated frequency
* Facilitate informal, formal, and group trainings to retail associates and managers
* Report industry intelligence regarding the program and marketing environment strategically for each tactic
* Provide merchandising services for display compliance verification and competitive details by maintaining product displays and product functionality while in-store
* Respond to supervisor requests and correspondence in a timely fashion
* Other tasks as requested by your supervisor

**WHAT YOU'LL BRING**

**Experience and Education:**

* High School Diploma or equivalent
* 1+ years of Retail, Marketing, or Agency experience; field representative experience is helpful, but not mandatory
* Experience in training and communications

**Skills and Attributes:**

* Must obtain ServSafe certification before starting this position – trained upon hiring
* Strong communication skills
* Detail oriented
* Strong presentation skills
* Proficiency in MS Excel, Word, Outlook, and PowerPoint applications
* Ability to travel within assigned territory and approved out-of-scope assignments as needed
* Ability to drive on behalf of the company in compliance with company guidelines with reliable transportation, a valid driver’s license, and proof of auto insurance

**Physical Requirements:**

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is required to:

* Regularly sit, stand, walk, bend over, grasp, talk and/or hear, and drive
* Occasionally lift and carry supplies up to 20 lbs.
* Continuous hand/eye coordination and fine manipulation

We will consider for employment all qualified Applicants, including those with Criminal Histories, in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable state and local laws, including the City of Los Angeles’ Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance.

Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.
